@coffeekraken.sugar.js.filter.SGooeySvgF.name: SGooeySvgFilter
@coffeekraken.sugar.js.filter.SGooeySvgF.description:
This class represent a gooey SVG filter that can be applied on any HTMLElement.
Here's the values that you can control on it:
- blur: The amout of blur you want
- contrast: The amout of contrast you want
- shrink: The amount of shrink you want
- amount: The overall amount of effect you want

blur.name: blur
blur.description: Get/Set the blur amount to produce the effect

contrast.name: contrast
contrast.description: Get the contrast amount to produce the effect

shrink.name: shrink
shrink.description: Get the shrink amount to produce the effect

amount.name: amount
amount.description: Set the overall amount of effect to produce

@coffeekraken.sugar.js.keyboard.hotkey.name: hotkey
@coffeekraken.sugar.js.keyboard.hotkey.description:
Simple function to add a hotkey like "ctrl+a" and an handler function that will be called when the hotkey has been pressed
The following keys are supported:
- shift, option, alt, ctrl, control, command
- backspace, tab, clear, enter, return, esc, escape, space, up, down, left, right, home, end, pageup, pagedown, del, delete
- from f1 to f19
- all the letters keys

You can pass an option object to your hotkey function call.

@coffeekraken.sugar.js.storage.SIndexDb.name: SIndexDb
@coffeekraken.sugar.js.storage.SIndexDb.description:
This SIndexDb class gives you a nive and easy way to interact with your indexDb storage.
It provides a localStorage like api with the methods "setItem", "getItem", "getAll" and "removeItem"
wrapped in a nice Promise based api.
You can also use it through his static methods that are exacly the same as the instance ones.

setitem.name: setItem
setitem.description: This method allows you to add an item into your indexDb

getitem.name: getItem
getitem.description: This method allows you to get back an item from your indexDb

getall.name: getAll
getall.description: This method allows you to get back all the items of a table from your indexDb

removeitem.name: removeItem
removeitem.description: This method allows you to delete an item from your indexDb

has not been updated...

__fileHash('my/cool/folder'); // => YZOrKDx9LCLd8X39PoFTflXGpRU=,

@coffeekraken.sugar.node.fs.pool.description:
This function simply take as parameter a glob (or array of globs) pattern(s)
and return an SPromise instance through which you can subscribe to events like:
- ready: Emitted once the pool is ready
- add: Emitted when a file has been added
- change: Emitted when a file has been updated (alias to update)
- unlink: Emitted when a file has been deleted

@coffeekraken.sugar.node.dependencies.de.name: dependenciesHash
@coffeekraken.sugar.node.dependencies.de.description:
This function take as input an object that follows the structure described in the example bellow.
With that, if will recursively (for files dependencies) load them, check if they have some dependencies,
and create a hash depending on all of that.
Here's the process steps:
1. Check the files dependencies.
2. If their's, load recursively these dependencies and start the process over them again
3. Create a hash for the current dependency with using all non "files" dependencies as well as the file updated timestamp
4. Make this process recursively until all the "files" have been processed
5. Return the final hash for your dependency object

@coffeekraken.sugar.node.process.exitCle.name: exitCleanup
@coffeekraken.sugar.node.process.exitCle.description:
This function simply cleanup all the processes and other things that stay alive after that
the main process has been terminated

example.code:
import { __exitCleanup } from '@coffeekraken/sugar/process';
await __exitCleanup();

@coffeekraken.sugar.node.process.onProce.name: onProcessExit
@coffeekraken.sugar.node.process.onProce.description:
This function allows you to register a callback to execute when the process
is exiting by one of these events:
- exit: when app is closing
- SIGINT: on ctrl+c
- SIGUSR1, SIGUSR2: catches "kill pid"
- uncaughtException: catches uncaught exceptions

@coffeekraken.sugar.node.index.name: index
@coffeekraken.sugar.node.index.description:
This file is the "initialisation" one for the sugar node toolkit.
It's optional to include it but if you do, you will get these features "for free":
- Display errors
- Process exit cleanup

example.code:
import { __processSugar } from '@coffeekraken/sugar/process';
__processSugar();

@coffeekraken.sugar.node.string.replaceT.name: replaceTokens
@coffeekraken.sugar.node.string.replaceT.description:
This function take as input a string and replace some tokens using these functions:
- sharedReplaceToken: Replace tokens like %moduleSystem
- replacePathTokens: Replace path tokens like %packageRootDir, %distJsDir, etc...
- replacePackageJsonTokens: Replace tokens like %packageJson.name, %packageJson.version, etc... with package.json values

example.code:
import { __replaceTokens } from '@coffeekraken/sugar/string';
__replaceTokens('Hello %packageJson.name, hope you are doing well (%packageRootDir)');

@coffeekraken.sugar.php.css.buildMediaQu.name: buildMediaQuery
@coffeekraken.sugar.php.css.buildMediaQu.description:
This function takes a media query definition like "mobile", ">mobile", "=tablet", etc... and
returns you the corresponding css media query string.
This is based on the passed settings that you can pass as a second parameter.

Here's the default medias availables:
- mobile: 0-639px
- tablet: 640px-1279px
- desktop: 1280px-2047px
- wide: 2048px-...
- dwarf: 0-700px (height)
You can as well override these in the $settings parameter.

watch.name: watch
watch.description:
This method allows you to specify which Array methods you want to watch by passing an array of methods names like ['push','pop'].
You can also specify the handler function that will be called on each array updates, etc...

unwatch.name: unwatch
unwatch.description:
This methods allows you to unwatch a process started with the "watch" method.
You have to pass as parameter the watchId that the "watch" method has returned you.

example.code:
const watchId = myArray.watch('push', (obj) => //...);
myArray.unwatch(watchId);

@coffeekraken.sugar.shared.array.sameIte.name: sameItems
@coffeekraken.sugar.shared.array.sameIte.description:
This function take two arrays and return all the items that are the same.
You can specify if you want only comparing by reference for object, etc... or if
you want to transform items in hashes and compare that instead.

example.code:
import { __sameItems } from '@coffeekraken/sugar/array';
__sameItems([1,2,3,4], [1,3,5]); // => [1,3]

@coffeekraken.sugar.js.cli.buildCommandL.name: buildCommandLine
@coffeekraken.sugar.js.cli.buildCommandL.description:
This function takes as parameters a command line (with tokens), an arguments object and a definition object to
generate the final command line string to launch.
A token is simply a string that begin with "[" and end with "]" like so: "[mytoken]".
Each arguments of the definition object can be a token. If you have an argument called "hostname", the corresponding token will be "[hostname]".
A special token called "[arguments]" is needed if you want the passed arguments to be integrated to the builded command line.

@coffeekraken.sugar.shared.es6.SEs6Impor.name: SEs6Import
@coffeekraken.sugar.shared.es6.SEs6Impor.description:
This class represent an es6 import statement with properties like:
- path {String}: The import path
- default {String}: The default import name
- star {String}: The start import name "import
as something from ..."
- named {Array<Object>}: THe named imports
- raw {String}: The raw import statement

example.code:
import { __SEs6Import } from '@coffeekraken/sugar/es6';
const import = new __SEs6Import('import coco from "something";');

parsecode.name: parseCode
parsecode.description:
This function simply parse the passed code and return an array of all the
founded es6 imports

default.name: default
default.description: Store the statement default import name

star.name: star
star.description:
Store the statement star name like "import
as coco from ..."

named.name: named
named.description:
Store the statement named imports with these properties:
- name {String}: The import name
- as {String}: The import as alias

tostring.name: toString
tostring.description: Return the builded version of the import

You can filter extensions by types:
- audio
- compressed
- data
- disc
- email
- executable
- font
- image
- media
- programming
- text
- video
- web

import { __commonFileExtensions } from '@coffeekraken/sugar/extension';
const extensions = __commonFileExtensions(); // => ['avi','mp3',...]

@coffeekraken.sugar.shared.function.ease.name: easeInterval
@coffeekraken.sugar.shared.function.ease.description:
This function allows you to call a callback function exactly as the `setInterval` would do but with an easing that you can specify,
as well as an `interval` setting to customize how many time your function will be called.
By default this function will pass the "easedPercent" that represent the percentage of your passed "duration" with the easing applied on it.
With that you can make everything you want inside your callback function.

@coffeekraken.sugar.shared.object.deepPr.name: deepProxy
@coffeekraken.sugar.shared.object.deepPr.description:
This function allows you to add Proxy to an object in deep fashion.
Normally the Proxy process only the level on which it has been added. Here we add Proxy to all the
object levels and to new properties as well.

On the returned proxied object, you will have access to the ```revoke``` method that you can call to revoke the proxy applied.
This method will return you a shallow version of the proxied object that you can use as you want

the "contributors" array the same way as the "author" one, etc... Here's the list
of processed actions:
1. Transform the string version of the "author" field into an object with the properties "name", "email" and "url"
2. Transform the string version of the "contributors" field into an object with the properties "name", "email" and "url"

@coffeekraken.sugar.js.value.typeof.name: typeof
@coffeekraken.sugar.js.value.typeof.description:
This function return the correct type of the passed value.
It support the recognition of arrays and return 'Array' as property type.
You can olso ask the function to gives you the "of" types of the passed value. This mean that if you
pass an Array like so "[10,'Hello',true]" and that you ask for "of" types, it will returns you
"Array<Integer|String|Boolean>".
Another feature is to ask the result as an object like so:
{
type: 'Array',
of: ['Integer','String','Boolean']
}
You can ask also the typeof function to returns you the actual class name if the passed value is an instance
of an custom class.

@coffeekraken.sugar.shared.url.parseSche.name: parseSchema
@coffeekraken.sugar.shared.url.parseSche.description:
This function take two arguments. The first one is the url to parse and the second is a schema to scan the url with.
The schema describe the pathname of an url and tell's how to analyze it.
Here's a little description with some example of schemas:
- "{param1}/{param2}/{param3}": This schema describe that your Url must have 3 "values" named param1, param2 and param3
- If my Url is "something.com/hello/world/plop", my schema is respected and I can have access to the values through the "schema.params.param1", "schema.params.param2", etc...
- "{hello:string}/{world:number}/{?idx:number}": This schema describe that the Url can have 3 "values" but the last one is optional
- If my Url is "something.com/plop/3/1", my schema is respected
- If my Url is "something.com/plop/2", my schema is respected
- If my Url is "something.com/plop/hello/2", my schema is not respected due to the fact that the param named "world" has to be a number

@coffeekraken.sugar.php.twig.css.marginC.name: marginClasses
@coffeekraken.sugar.php.twig.css.marginC.description:
This function takes an object|array of margins issued from the themeMargin.config.ts configuration file like:
- "blockStart" => 10
- "inlineEnd" => 30
- "block" => 10
- etc...
This function will returns you the classes like "s-mbs:10" that you can apply where you want in your views.

example.code:
<div class="{{ marginClasses({
 block: 10
}) }}

@coffeekraken.s-vite.node.interface.SVit.name: SViteBuildParamsInterface
@coffeekraken.s-vite.node.interface.SVit.description: This class represent the interface that describe parameters of the SKitchenViteProcess

input.description: Specify the input js/ts file to use for the build

type.description: Specify the type(s) of build you want. Can be "lib", "bundle" or "module"

format.description: Specify the format(s) of the output build. Can be "es","umd","cjs" or "iife"

target.description: Specify the target you want for your build. Can be "modules","esnext","es2015","es2016" or "es2020"

watch.description: Specify if you want the process to watch for updates and rebuild automatically

buildInitial.description: Specify if you want to build first and watch the changes after of to only build when changes are detected

lib.description: Specify if your build type is "lib". Same as setting the "type" argument to "lib"

bundle.description: Specify if your build type is "bundle". Same as setting the "type" argument to "bundle"

noWrite.description: Specify if you want to ust build but not write file(s) to the filesystem

prod.description: Specify if your build is made for production environment or not. This will automatically minify and optimize your build

chunks.description: Specify if you allow your build to be separated into multiple chunks or not

minify.description: Specify if you want to minify your build or not

analyze.description: Specify if you want an analyze report of your build. This use the rollup analyze plugin under the hood

package.description: AMAZING ViteJs encapsulation to make it work flowlessly inside of the Coffeekraken toolchain.

@coffeekraken.s-validator.shared.validat.name: max
@coffeekraken.s-validator.shared.validat.description:
Validate using the "max" rule.
Here's the rules depending on the passed value type:

- String: Has to have at max n characters
- Number: Has to be greater than n
- Array: Has to have at max n elements
- Object: Has to have at max n properties

example.code:
import __maxValidator from '@coffeekraken/s-validator/validators/max
__maxValidator('hello world', 10);

package.name: @coffeekraken/s-validator
package.description: Simple and powerfull class that let you pass a value with rules to validate it, and get back what's ok and what's not with messages for each errors.

@coffeekraken.s-validator.shared.validat.name: min
@coffeekraken.s-validator.shared.validat.description:
Validate using the "min" rule.
Here's the rules depending on the passed value type:

- String: Has to have at least n characters
- Number: Has to be greater than n
- Array: Has to have at least n elements
- Object: Has to have at least n properties

example.code:
import __minValidator from '@coffeekraken/s-validator/validators/min
__minValidator('hello world', 2);

@coffeekraken.s-url.shated.SUrl.name: SUrl
@coffeekraken.s-url.shated.SUrl.description:
Simple class that is useful to parse a URL (or the current browser URL) and gives you back
an instance that has all these values availables as well as functions to modify the instancied URL:
- protocol: The protocol scheme of the URL (e.g. http:).
- slashes: A boolean which indicates whether the protocol is followed by two forward slashes (//).
- auth: Authentication information portion (e.g. username:password).
- username: Username of basic authentication.
- password: Password of basic authentication.
- host: Host name with port number.
- hostname: Host name without port number.
- port: Optional port number.
- pathname: URL path.
- query: Parsed object containing query string
- queryString: Origin query string from the URL
- hash: The "fragment" portion of the URL including the pound-sign (#).
- href: The full URL.
- origin: The origin of the URL.
- schema: The schema property gives you access to an object containing these properties (only if you have provided the settings.schema setting):
- match (true) {Boolean}: Tells you if your current url match the passed schema
- errors (null) {Object}: Gives you access to which param(s) is/are in error
- params (null) {Object}: Gives you access to each params specified in the schema with their values, etc...

This class use internally the `url-parse` npm module that you can find here: https://www.npmjs.com/package/url-parse

schema.name: schema
schema.description:
Access the schema parsing result if the settings.schema has been provided.
This object contain these properties:
- params ({}) {Object}: Store the path params found like /{client}/{name}
- errors ({}) {Object}: Store the parsing errors if has some
- match (true) {Boolean}: Store if the current url match with the provided schema

slashes.name: slashes
slashes.description: A boolean which indicates whether the protocol is followed by two forward slashes (//).

host.name: host
host.description: Get/set Host name with port number

hostname.name: hostname
hostname.description: Get/set host name without port number

querystring.name: queryString
querystring.description: Origin query string from the URL

hash.name: hash
hash.description: The "fragment" portion of the URL including the pound-sign (#)

tostring.name: toString
tostring.description: Return the full URL in string format

example.code: console.log(myUrl.toString()); // => https://google.com

package.name: @coffeekraken/s-url
package.description: Simple class that represent a URL on which you will have access to the URL details like protocol, etc...

@coffeekraken.s-type.shared.SType.name: SType
@coffeekraken.s-type.shared.SType.description:
This class is the main one that MUST be used as parent one
when creating any type like object, string, etc...

typestring.name: typeString
typestring.description: This store the typeString passed in the constructor

types.name: types
types.description: This specify the type represented by this SType instance

registertype.name: registerType
registertype.description:
This static method allows you to register a new rule
by passing a valid ISDescriptorRule object

parsetypestring.name: parseTypeString
parsetypestring.description: This static method allows you to parse a type string using the `@coffeekraken/sugar/shared/type/parseTypeString` function.

is.name: is
is.description:
This method make a simple check to see if the passed value correspond to the
type that this instance represent.
Same as the ```check``` method, but return only a Boolean.

check.name: check
check.description:
This method allows you to make sure the passed value correspond with the type(s)
this instance represent
If all is ok, return true, otherwise return an instance of the STypeResult class that
describe what is wrong

cast.name: cast
cast.description:
This method allows you to cast the passed value to the wanted type.
!!! If multiple types are passed in the typeString, the first one that
is "castable" to will be used.

canhavechilds.name: canHaveChilds
canhavechilds.description: This method simply take a value and return true if can have child(s), false if not

name.name: name
name.description: Access the descriptor name. Either the value of settings.name, or the constructor name

id.name: id
id.description: Access the descriptor id. Either the value of settings.name, or the constructor name

package.name: @coffeekraken/s-type
package.description: Low level class that allows to define types and behaviors (cast, etc...), then apply these types on values to get back casted values or casting errors...

This class represent what you will get back from the ```SType.apply``` method.
You will be able to generate some string terminal version of the return as well as some html
version if needed

typestring.name: typeString
typestring.description: Access the type in string format

value.name: value
value.description: Access the value passed to be type validated

hasissues.name: hasIssues
hasissues.description: Return true if some issues have been detected, false if not

tostring.name: toString
tostring.description: This method return a string terminal compatible or html of this result object

toconsole.name: toConsole
toconsole.description:
This method simply returns you a terminal compatible string
of the interface checking result

@coffeekraken.s-timer.shared.STimer.name: STimer
@coffeekraken.s-timer.shared.STimer.description:
Class that let you create and handle timer with ease.
With this class you can set some callback function that will be
called each x ms or tell that you want your callbacks to be called
a certain number of time during the timer time.
This class extends the SPromise one, meaning that you can subscribe to differents "events" emited by the timer instance. Here's the list:
- complete: emited when the timer is completed
- tick: emited at each ticks depending on your settings
- duration: emited when the duration has been changed
- tickCount: emited when the tickCount has been changed
- reset: emited when the timer has been reseted
- start: emited when the timer starts
- pause: emited when the timer has been paused
- stop: emited when the timer has been stoped
- destroy: emited when the timer has been destroyed

remaing.name: remaing
remaing.description: Get the remaining time in ms

duration.name: duration
duration.description: Set or get the duration. Can be a number in milliseconds, or a time string like '1m', '2s', etc...

percentage.name: percentage
percentage.description: Get the current timer advancement percentage

isstarted.name: isStarted
isstarted.description: Check if the timer is started

package.name: @coffeekraken/s-timer
package.description: Simple class to handle timers.

@coffeekraken.s-theme.config.theme.cssVa.name: cssVariables
@coffeekraken.s-theme.config.theme.cssVa.description:
Specify which config(s) you want to be printed in your css as variables.
If we have a configuration available like "some.thing.cool", the outgoing variable
will be "--s-theme-some-thing-cool".
You can specify some patterns like "color.", "typo.something.*" cause the check will be
made using micromatch package

package.name: @coffeekraken/s-theme
package.description: Central class to handle your theme in the Coffeekraken toolchain. It allows you to switch theme|variant, list available themes, etc...

@coffeekraken.s-theme.config.themeMedia..name: defaultAction
@coffeekraken.s-theme.config.themeMedia..description:
Specify the default action to apply if you don't specify one in your media
mixin call like ```@sugar.media('tablet') {...}```. If the defaultAction is set to ">=",
the above media will be the same as ```@sugar.media('>=tablet') {...}```
Note that by default it is set to "<=" which mean "desktop first"

package.name: @coffeekraken/s-theme
package.description: Central class to handle your theme in the Coffeekraken toolchain. It allows you to switch theme|variant, list available themes, etc...

@coffeekraken.s-theme.config.themeMedia..name: defaultMedia
@coffeekraken.s-theme.config.themeMedia..description:
Specify the default media that will not generate any media queries at all like in mobile first, it will
be the mobile media and in desktop first it will be the desktop media

@coffeekraken.s-theme.js.STheme.name: STheme
@coffeekraken.s-theme.js.STheme.description:
This class represent the sugar theme you've passed the name in the constructor.
Once you have an instance of this theme you will have access to a lot of utilities
methods like "loopOnColors", etc...

theme.name: theme
theme.description: Store the current theme applied from the html tag context or from the config

variant.name: variant
variant.description: Store the current variant applied from the html tag context or from the config

settheme.name: setTheme
settheme.description: This method allows you to set the current applied theme and get back an STheme instance

applytheme.name: applyTheme
applytheme.description: This method allows you to apply a theme on a particular $context HTMLElement

isdarkmode.name: isDarkMode
isdarkmode.description: This method returns true if the theme variant is dark, false if not

preferdark.name: preferDark
preferdark.description: This method just check if the user prefer the dark mode or not.

setthemevariant.name: setThemeVariant
setthemevariant.description: This method allows you to set the current applied theme variant and get back an STheme instance

init.name: init
init.description: This method allows you to init the your STheme instance, restore savec updated if their some, etc...

getthememetas.name: getThemeMetas
getthememetas.description: This method allows you to get the theme metas like "name", "theme" and "variant" from the passed HTMLElement

getcurrenttheme.name: getCurrentTheme
getcurrenttheme.description: This method allows you to get the current applied theme STheme instance

applycurrentcolor.name: applyCurrentColor
applycurrentcolor.description: This static method allows you to apply a color on a particular context

setcolor.name: setColor
setcolor.description: THis method allows you to set a color for the theme that represent this instance

set.name: set
set.description:
This method allows you to set a value of the current theme.
Specify the value you want to set using the dotPath syntax like "color.accent.color", etc...

getcolor.name: getColor
getcolor.description: THis method allows you to access a particular theme color in a particular context

applyoverridedconfigs.name: applyOverridedConfigs
applyoverridedconfigs.description: This method allows you to apply the overrided configs on your dom context.

save.name: save
save.description:
This method allows you to save locally the current theme with the changes applied using the `set` method.
The theme will be savec in localStorage and restored on page load to apply updates correctly

restore.name: restore
restore.description: This method allows you to restore locally the current theme with the changes applied using the `set` method.

clear.name: clear
clear.description: This method allows you to clear locally the current theme with the changes applied using the `set` method.

sortmedia.name: sortMedia
sortmedia.description:
This function takes as input the "media" object of the `frontspec.json` file and sort the "queries"
depending on the "defaultAction" specified.

theme.name: theme
theme.description: Store the current theme setted in the config.theme namespace

variant.name: variant
variant.description: Store the current variant setted in the config.variant namespace

id.name: id
id.description: Store the computed theme id builded from the theme name and theme variant

isdark.name: isDark
isdark.description: This method returns true if the theme variant is dark, false if not

ismobilefirst.name: isMobileFirst
ismobilefirst.description:
This method returns true if the theme is configured to be mobile first.
Mobile first is true when the "config.theme.media.defaultAction" is set to "<="

getthememetas.name: getThemeMetas
getthememetas.description: This method allows you to get the theme metas like "name", "theme" and "variant" from the passed HTMLElement

gettheme.name: getTheme
gettheme.description:
This static method allows you to get quicky an STheme instance of the passed theme.
It will also check if an instance already exists for this theme and return it if so...

hash.name: hash
hash.description:
This hash accessor gives you access to the actual theme configuration hash.
You can specify a dot path to get the hash of a sub configuration

cssvar.name: cssVar
cssvar.description:
This function take a simple theme dot path and returns the proper
variable string with the value fallback.

example.code:
import { cssVar } from '@coffeekraken/s-postcss-sugar-plugin';
cssVar('ui.button.padding'); // => var(--s-theme-ui-button-padding, 1em 1.2em)

buildmediaquery.name: buildMediaQuery
buildmediaquery.description: This static method allows you to built a media query by passing args like "mobile", ">tablet", etc...

jsobjecttocssproperties.name: jsObjectToCssProperties
jsobjecttocssproperties.description:
This static method allows you to pass a javascript object that contain css properties
and it will returns the processed css string. Some properties can accept internal theme configuration
settings like `font-size`, `color`, etc...:

- `font-family`
- `font-size`
- `color`
- `background-color`
- `border-radius`: And all border-radius properties like `border-top-left-radius`, etc...
- `border-width`
- `transition`
- `margin`: And all the margins properties like `margin-inline`, etc...
- `padding`: And all the paddings properties like `padding-block`, etc...
- `depth`: Special property that will apply nice shadows depending on your theme configuration
- `default-color`: Apply the default color using `@sugar.color` mixin

remapcsscolor.name: remapCssColor
remapcsscolor.description:
This static method allows you to remap a color to another and returns the needed css
variables string.

tocssvars.name: toCssVars
tocssvars.description: This static method allows you to transform a theme/variant into css variables

getsafe.name: getSafe
getsafe.description: This static method allows you to access the active theme config without throwing an error if it not exists

get.name: get
get.description:
This method allows you to access a value of the current theme
using a dot path like "color.accent", etc...

set.name: set
set.description:
This method allows you to set a value of the current theme.
Specify the value you want to set using the dotPath syntax like "color.accent.color", etc...

proxynonexistinguidotpath.name: proxyNonExistingUiDotpath
proxynonexistinguidotpath.description:
This method alloes you to get the actual dotpath for the passed one.
If you try to get "ui.range.borderRadius" and that this config does not exists in the
themeUi file(s), it will fallback to "ui.default.borderRadius"

getoverridedconfig.name: getOverridedConfig
getoverridedconfig.description:
This method allows you to get the overrided config of the current theme.
These configs are the ones that are overrided by the use of the `set` method.

emitsavedevent.name: emitSavedEvent
emitsavedevent.description: This method simply emit a "saved" event on the theme instance with details like the overrifed config.

themesconfig.name: themesConfig
themesconfig.description: Get access to the themes configuration

restore.name: restore
restore.description: This method allows you to restore some configs by merging the passed ones with the overrided configs.

clear.name: clear
clear.description: This method allows you to clear the overrided configs and restore the default ones.

basecolors.name: baseColors
basecolors.description:
This function returns a simple object with the base colors and their value
from the theme config.

looponcolors.name: loopOnColors
looponcolors.description:
This utility function allows you to loop quickly and efficiently on
theme colors and their's modifiers defined

@coffeekraken.s-sugar-feature.js.SSugarF.name: SSugarFeature
@coffeekraken.s-sugar-feature.js.SSugarF.description:
This feature allows you to apply some "nice to have" features like having a "scrolled" class applied on the body
when the user has scroll in the page or having access to a `--vh` css variable that represent the exact
viewport innerHeight and avoid having issues with mobile different viewport height values. Note that if you use
the `sPostcssSugarPlugin` postcss plugin, you can use the `vh` unit as normal and if will automatically take the
value of the `--vh` variable if it exists.
More feature can be added in the future depending on the needs.

example.title: Simple usage
example.description: Simply add the `s-sugar` property on your body tag
example.code:
<bodyTag s-sugar>

</bodyTag>

pleasantCss.description: Specify if you want the "pleasant css" syntax in your pages

containerQuery.description: Specify if you want support for container queries in your css or not

scrolled.description: Specify if you want the `scrolled` class to be applied on the `body` element when the page has been scrolled

scrolledDelta.description: Specify after how many scroll the scrolled class will be applied

vhvar.description: Specify if you want the `--vh` css variable to be computed and available

inputAdditionalAttributes.description: Specify if you want to have the additional attributes on inputs like "has-value", "empty" and "dirty" or not

resizeTransmations.description: Specify if you want all the transitions and animations cleared during window resize

linksStateAttributes.description: Specify if you want to have the state attributes on links like "actual" and "actual-child" or not

preventScrollRestoration.description: Specify if you want to prevent the scroll restoration behavior on chrome that can usually be anoying

env.description: Specify if you want to display the current environment at start

package.name: @coffeekraken/s-sugar-feature
package.description: Global feature that you can apply on your body and that will handle convinient things like automatically expand your "pleasant css" classes, add/remove a "scrolled" class on the body, remove animations when user resize the page, and more...

resizeTransmations.description: Specify if you want all the transitions and animations cleared during window resize

To override the

all the icons but you can create a "kit" on the fontaawesome website and load only
the icons you need.

loaded in your css if you use some fontawesome icons.

@coffeekraken.s-sugar-config.js.SSugarCo.name: SSugarConfig
@coffeekraken.s-sugar-config.js.SSugarCo.description:
This class allows you to access your sugar configurations that are
injected into the page by the @coffeekraken/s-vite-sugar-plugin

example.code:
import __SSugarConfig from '@coffeekraken/s-sugar-config';
__SSugarConfig.get('something.cool');

get.name: get
get.description: This static method allows you to access your configurations

set.name: set
set.description: This static method allows you to set a configuration value

package.name: @coffeekraken/s-sugar-config
package.description: Powerful config management class that let you access the .config.(j|t)s files stored either at (mono)repo, package (.sugar/*) or user (.local/.sugar/*) level.

@coffeekraken.s-sugar-config.node.SSugar.name: SSugarConfig
@coffeekraken.s-sugar-config.node.SSugar.description:
This function allows you to access easily the configurations stored in the ```sugar.config.js```.
The returned configuration is the result of the default sugar config stored in the toolkit and the
app defined config stored in current application root folder

example.code:
import __SSugarConfig from '@coffeekraken/s-sugar-config';
__SSugarConfig.get('scss.unit'); // => rem

@coffeekraken.s-sugar-config.shared.regi.name: registerFolder
@coffeekraken.s-sugar-config.shared.regi.description:
This function allows you to register some folders to be taken in consideration
when accessing the config using the ```sugar``` function

example.code:
import registerFolder from '@coffeekraken/sugar/shared/config/registerFolder';
registerFolder('/something/cool');

filesrealpaths.name: filesRealPaths
filesrealpaths.description: Access the config files real paths

foldersrealpaths.name: foldersRealPaths
foldersrealpaths.description: Access the config registered folders real pathes

load.name: load
load.description: This method is responsible to load the config depending on the passed ```sugarConfig.env``` setting

tojson.name: toJson
tojson.description: This function returns you the configuration as a json object

toobject.name: toObject
toobject.description: This function returns you the configuration as an object

isloaded.name: isLoaded
isloaded.description:
This static method allows you to test if the default or a particular configuration
is loaded or not

todocblocks.name: toDocblocks
todocblocks.description: This function take a config id as parameter and returns an array of docblocks parsed objects

hash.name: hash
hash.description:
This hash function gives you access to the actual configuration hash.
You can specify a dot path to get the hash of a sub configuration

get.name: get
get.description: This method allows you to get a configuration back by passing a dotpath like "something.else"

getsafe.name: getSafe
getsafe.description: Same as the "get" method but does not throw error if the config is not accessible...

set.name: set
set.description: This method allows you to set a configuration back by passing a dotpath like "something.else"

cache.name: cache
cache.description: Save the config in the cache to load it faster next time

example.code: await config.cache();

package.name: @coffeekraken/s-stdio
package.description: Clean and extensible Stdio system that make use of the @coffeekraken/s-event-emitter event system to listen to "log" or "ask" events and display them nicely with our built-in terminal implementation or anywhere else if you extends it.

@coffeekraken.s-stdio.sugar.node.stdio.S.name: SStdio
@coffeekraken.s-stdio.sugar.node.stdio.S.description:
This class represent the base one for all the "Stdio"
compatible setting.

registercomponent.name: registerComponent
registercomponent.description:
This static method allows you to register a new Stdio component
that you will be able to use then through the "type" property of
the logObj passed to the STerminalStdio instance.

existingornew.name: existingOrNew
existingornew.description: This static method allows you to get back either an existing stdio instance or a new one

new.name: new
new.description:
This static method is a sugar to instanciate an stdio by specifying some sources,
and either a path to a SStdio class, an SStdio class directly or a pre-registered
stdio id like:
- inherit: If is in node context, will fallback to STerminalStdio, if in browser, in SConsoleStdio
-
- terminal: STerminalStdio (node only)
- console: SConsoleStdio (browser only)

display.name: display
display.description: This method tells the stdio instance that it has been showned.

hide.name: hide
hide.description: This method tells the stdio instance that it has been hided

registersource.name: registerSource
registersource.description:
This method simply listen to the process and log the values getted
from it into the panel

log.name: log
log.description:
This method is the one called to log something.
It will call the ```_log``` method that each implementation of the
SStdio class MUST have

ask.name: ask
ask.description:
This method is the one called to ask something.
It will call the ```_ask``` method that each implementation of the
SStdio class MUST have

isdisplayed.name: isDisplayed
isdisplayed.description: true if the stdio if actually displayed, false if not

package.name: @coffeekraken/s-stdio
package.description: Clean and extensible Stdio system that make use of the @coffeekraken/s-event-emitter event system to listen to "log" or "ask" events and display them nicely with our built-in terminal implementation or anywhere else if you extends it.

@coffeekraken.s-stdio.node.basic.SBasicS.name: SBasicStdio
@coffeekraken.s-stdio.node.basic.SBasicS.description: This class represent a "basic" terminal strandard in out interface.

example.code:
import SBasicStdio from '@coffeekraken/s-stdio';
const terminal = new SBasicStdio(mySource);

package.name: @coffeekraken/s-stdio
package.description: Clean and extensible Stdio system that make use of the @coffeekraken/s-event-emitter event system to listen to "log" or "ask" events and display them nicely with our built-in terminal implementation or anywhere else if you extends it.

@coffeekraken.s-stdio.shared.interface.S.name: SStdioSettingsInterface
@coffeekraken.s-stdio.shared.interface.S.description: This class represent the interface that describe SStdio settings

filter.description: Specify a function that will be used to filter the logs. It will take the log object as parameter and MUST return a boolean.

processor.description: Specify a function that will be used to process the logs. It will take the log object and MUST return it, updated or not...

defaultLogObj.description: Specify a default log object that will be used as base for each received logs

defaultAskObj.description: Specify a default ask object that will be used as base for each received questions (ask)

@coffeekraken.s-specs.php.SSpecs.name: SSpecs
@coffeekraken.s-specs.php.SSpecs.description:
This class allows you to access with ease some specification file(s) that supports internal and external references to other files, etc...
This is usefull to build specification files in json format that make share some parts through common files, etc...
You will also have easy access to your files through "namespaces" that represent different folders on your system. This will simplify
the way you read your files by prefixing your dotpath (simple fs "/" replacement) with the namespace you want to look in.

frominterface.name: fromInterface
frominterface.description: This method allows you to convert an SInterface class into a spec object

applyvaluestospecs.name: applyValuesToSpecs

It will apply each values to the "value" property of each props

read.name: read
read.description: This method allows you to read a spec file and/or a value inside the passed spec file.

list.name: list
list.description: This method allows you to list all the available spec files inside a particular namespace(s), or simply all.

resolve.name: resolve
resolve.description: This method allows you to pass a specJson object and resolve all the "@..." values in it

package.name: @coffeekraken/s-specs
package.description: Package that let you access some json specifications files with feature like referencing values between files and more

direction.description: Specify the slider direction. Can be `horizontal` or `vertical`

behaviors.description: Specify the available behaviors for the slider

behavior.description: Specify which behavior your want to use for your slider. Behavior are like "presets" with different animations, etc...

pad.description: Specify if you want to pad the slides if for example the first slide does not take the while width of the slider, a padding-(block|inline)-start will be applied to center this first slide. Same for the last one

nextIconClass.description: Specify the class of the next icon

previousIconClass.description: Specify the class of the previous icon

uiContainer.description: Specify if you want an "s-container:..." class applied on the .s-slider__ui element

controls.description: Specify if you want to display the controls or not. Controls are the previous and next icons

nav.description: Specify if you want to display the nav or not. Nav are the dots

swipe.description: Specify if you want your slider to support swipe navigation or not

mousewheel.description: Specify if you want to enable the mousewheel event on the slider or not

clickOnSlide.description: Specify if you want to enable the click on the slides to navigate or not

loop.description: Specify if you want to enable the loop behavior or not

progress.description: Specify if you want to display the progress bar or not

timer.description: Specify a timer that will be applied on each slides and go to the next one after the timer is over. For custom timer by slide, specify the `timer="1200"` attribute on the slides you want

autoplay.description: Specify if you want the slider to auto play itself when some timer(s) has been set

intersectionClasses.description: Specify if you want the classes that describe each slide intersection classes like "in-10", "in-20", etc...

transitionDuration.description: Specify the transition duration of the slider in ms

transitionEasing.description: Specify the transition easing of the slider

transitionHandler.description: Specify a function that will take care of transitioning the slider from the current item to the next/previous

applypad.name: applyPad
applypad.description: This method apply the "pad" start and end on the slides wrapper

islast.name: isLast
islast.description: This method allows you to check if the actual slide is the last one

isfirst.name: isFirst
isfirst.description: This method allows you to check if the actual slide is the first one

getcurrentslideidx.name: getCurrentSlideIdx
getcurrentslideidx.description: Access the current slide idx. Begin from 0...

setcurrentslide.name: setCurrentSlide
setcurrentslide.description: This method allows you to get the current clide using an id or an idx.

currentslideidx.name: currentSlideIdx
currentslideidx.description: Access the current slide idx. Begin from 0...

getslideidxbyid.name: getSlideIdxById
getslideidxbyid.description: This method allows you to get back the slide idx by its id.

getslideelementbyidx.name: getSlideElementByIdx
getslideelementbyidx.description: This method allows you to get back a slide HTMLElement by its index.

getcurrentslide.name: getCurrentSlide
getcurrentslide.description: This method allows you to get back the current slide object <ISSliderComponentSlide> either by it's id, or by it's idx.

getslide.name: getSlide
getslide.description: This method allows you to get back a slide object <ISSliderComponentSlide> either by it's id, or by it's idx.

getfirstslide.name: getFirstSlide
getfirstslide.description: This method allows you to get the first slide of the slider

getlastslide.name: getLastSlide
getlastslide.description: This method allows you to get the last slide of the slider

getbehavior.name: getBehavior
getbehavior.description:
This method allows you to get the behavior object with all his functions binded
to this current slider instance

updateslidesclasses.name: updateSlidesClasses
updateslidesclasses.description:
This method allows you to update the slides "active" class accordingly to the
slider state. This can be used inside of a custom behavior for example.

gettimer.name: getTimer
gettimer.description: This method allows you to get back the timer object

isplaying.name: isPlaying
isplaying.description: This method allows you to know if the slider is currently playing or not

play.name: play
play.description: This method allows you to play the slider when a `timer` has been defined

stop.name: stop
stop.description: This method allows you to stop the slider

webcomponent.name: webcomponent
webcomponent.description:
This function allows you to define (register) your webcomponent with some default
props if needed.

@coffeekraken.s-request.shared.SRequest.name: SRequest
@coffeekraken.s-request.shared.SRequest.description:
Class that allows to simply handle ajax requests with ease.
This class give some useful features like :
- Promise support
- Recursive requests

retry.name: retry
retry.description: Reset the request settings variables and relaunch the request

send.name: send
send.description:
Send the request and return a promise that will be resolved once all the requests
have been made or rejected if one of the requests has returned an error...

package.name: @coffeekraken/s-request
package.description: Simple request class that make use of the AMAZING axios under the hood. The goal of this package is more to keep a single implementation for futur updates than anything else.

@coffeekraken.s-request.shared.interface.name: SRequestParamsInterface
@coffeekraken.s-request.shared.interface.description: This class represent the interface that describe SRequest parameters

baseUrl.description: Specify the base url to call like "https://api.github.com/2.0" for example. If the "url" setting is absolute, this setting will don't have any impact on your request...

method.description: The request method to use like GET, DELETE, HEAD, POST, OPTIONS, PUT or PATCH

headers.description: Specify some headers to add to the request

params.description: Specify some params to be sent through the URL. Must be a plain object or a URLSearchParams object

data.description: Specify some data you want to send with the request. This setting is available only for `PUT`, `POST`, and `PATCH` requests...

timeout.description: Specify time to wait before aborting the actual request. If setted in number format, this will mean milliseconds.

transformRequest.description: Allows changes to the request data before it is sent to the server. See [axios](https://github.com/axios/axios#response-schema) documentation for more.

transformResponse.description: Allows changes to the response data to be made before it is passed to then/catch. See [axios](https://github.com/axios/axios#response-schema) documentation for more.

paramsSerializer.description: An optional function in charge of serializing. See [axios](https://github.com/axios/axios#response-schema) documentation for more.

withCredentials.description: Indicates whether or not cross-site Access-Control requests should be made using credentials. See [axios](https://github.com/axios/axios#response-schema) documentation for more.

auth.description: indicates that HTTP Basic auth should be used, and supplies credentials. See [axios](https://github.com/axios/axios#response-schema) documentation for more.

responseType.description: Indicates encoding to use for decoding responses (Node.js only)

responseEncoding.description: indicates encoding to use for decoding responses (Node.js only). See [axios](https://github.com/axios/axios#response-schema) documentation for more.

xsrfCookieName.description: The name of the cookie to use as a value for xsrf token

xsrfHeaderName.description: The name of the http header that carries the xsrf token value

onUploadProgress.description: Allows handling of progress events for uploads browser only

onDownloadProgress.description: Allows handling of progress events for downloads browser only

maxContentLength.description: Defines the max size of the http response content in bytes allowed in node.js

maxBodyLength.description: (Node only option) defines the max size of the http request content in bytes allowed

validateStatus.description: Defines whether to resolve or reject the promise for a give HTTP response status code. See [axios](https://github.com/axios/axios#response-schema) documentation for more.

maxRedirects.description: Defines the maximum number of redirects to follow in node.js

socketPath.description: Defines a UNIX Socket to be used in node.js. See [axios](https://github.com/axios/axios#response-schema) documentation for more.

httpAgent.description: Define a custom agent to be used when performing http. See [axios](https://github.com/axios/axios#response-schema) documentation for more.

httpsAgent.description: Define a custom agent to be used when performing https. See [axios](https://github.com/axios/axios#response-schema) documentation for more.

proxy.description: Defines the hostname, port, and protocol of the proxy server. See [axios](https://github.com/axios/axios#response-schema) documentation for more.

cancelToken.description: Specifies a cancel token that can be used to cancel the request. See [axios](https://github.com/axios/axios#response-schema) documentation for more.

signal.description: an alternative way to cancel Axios requests using AbortController

decompress.description: indicates whether or not the response body should be decompressed automatically. See [axios](https://github.com/axios/axios#response-schema) documentation for more.

insecureHTTPParser.description: Indicates where to use an insecure HTTP parser that accepts invalid HTTP headers. See [axios](https://github.com/axios/axios#response-schema) documentation for more.

@coffeekraken.s-rating-component.js.SRat.name: SRatingComponent

example.title: Simple rating

name.description: Specify a name that will be attributed to the hidden input created automatically

value.description: Specify a base value for the rating

min.description: Specify the minimum rate you accept

max.description: Specify the maximum rate you accept

icon.description: This works only if you use the "s-icon:..." class notation. Define the icon you want to use

iconClass.description: Specify a custom icon class you want to use. If this is set, override the "icon" parameter

readonly.description: Specify if you want your rating component to just display the value and that the user cannot interact with it or not

package.name: @coffeekraken/s-range-component
package.description: Create nice and clean ranges using this web component. Support tooltip, target to display value, and more...

@coffeekraken.s-range-component.js.SRang.name: SRangeComponent
@coffeekraken.s-range-component.js.SRang.description:
This component specify a range with some additional features than the native one like
displaying the value automatically in tooltip or inline.

example.title: Simple range
example.code: <s-range name="myCoolRange" value="90" class="s-color:accent s-mbe:30"></s-range>

example.title: With tooltip
example.code: <s-range name="myOtherRanfe" class="s-mbe:30" tooltip></s-range>

example.title: With tooltip and colored
example.code: <s-range name="myOtherRanfe" class="s-mbe:30 s-color:accent" tooltip></s-range>

example.title: With steps
example.code: <s-range name="myRangeWithSteps" value="70" class="s-color:complementary s-mbe:30" step="5"></s-range>

example.title: Disabled
example.code: <s-range name="myRangeWithSteps" disabled value="70" class="s-color:complementary s-mbe:30" step="5"></s-range>

example.title: External target input
Some colors
example.code:
<s-range name="myRangeColoredSuccess" value="30" class="s-color:success s-mbe:30"></s-range>
<s-range name="myRangeColoredWarning" value="0" class="s-color:warning s-mbe:30"></s-range>
<s-range name="myRangeColoredError" value="1" min="0" max="10" class="s-color:error s-mbe:30"></s-range>

name.description: Specify the name to assign to the internal input[type="range"]

value.description: Specify the initial range value

min.description: Specify the minimal value or the range

max.description: Specify the maximal value of the range

step.description: Specify the steps between each values

target.description: Specify a css selector of any HTMLElement or HTMLInputElement in which to inject the value when the range is updated

tooltip.description: Specify if you want to display the value inside a tooltip on top of the thumb

disabled.description: Specify if this range is disabled

webcomponent.name: webcomponent
webcomponent.description:
This function allows you to define (register) your webcomponent with some default
props if needed.

package.name: @coffeekraken/s-promise
package.description: As simple as a native Promise, this package extends it with events capabilities using the @coffeekraken/s-event-emitter one.

@coffeekraken.s-promise.shared.SPromise.name: SPromise
@coffeekraken.s-promise.shared.SPromise.description:
This class works the same as the default Promise one. The difference is that you have more control on this one like
the possibility to resolve it multiple times. Here's a list of the "differences" and the "features" that this class provide:

queue.name: queue
queue.description:
This static method allows you to pass an array of promises that will be executed one after the other.
It will call the "callback" function if specified with the resolved promise as argument.

treatasvalue.name: treatAsValue
treatasvalue.description:
This method wrap the promise into a revocable proxy to allow
passing this Promise to methods like ```then```, etc... and make
this promise treated as a value and not as a chained promise.
Once you have done with this behavior, you just have to call
the ```restorePromiseBehavior``` on the returned proxy and
the default promise behavior will be restored

promisestate.name: promiseState
promisestate.description:
Access the promise state. Can be one of these:
- pending: When the promise is waiting for resolution or rejection
- resolved: When the promise has been resolved
- rejected: When the promise has been rejected
- canceled: When the promise has been canceled
- destroyed: When the promise has been destroyed

registerproxy.name: registerProxy
registerproxy.description:
ALlows you to register a proxy at a certain point of the promise lifecycle like:
- resolve: Allows you to edit the value that will be sent to the resolve point
- reject: Allows you to edit the value that will be sent to the reject point

is.name: is
is.description: Check is the promise is on one of the passed status

ispending.name: isPending
ispending.description: Return back true or false depending on the promise status

isresolved.name: isResolved
isresolved.description: Return back true or false depending on the promise status

isrejected.name: isRejected
isrejected.description: Return back true or false depending on the promise status

iscanceled.name: isCanceled
iscanceled.description: Return back true or false depending on the promise status

isdestroyed.name: isDestroyed
isdestroyed.description: Return back true or false depending on the promise status

resolve.name: resolve
resolve.description: This is the "resolve" method exposed on the promise itself for convinience

reject.name: reject
reject.description: This is the "reject" method exposed on the promise itself for convinience

cancel.name: cancel
cancel.description: This is the "cancel" method exposed on the promise itself for convinience

catch.name: catch
catch.description:
This method allows the SPromise user to register a function that will be called every time the "reject" one is called in the executor
The context of the callback will be the SPromise instance itself so you can call all the methods available like "resolve", "catch", etc using
the "this.resolve('something')" statusment. In an arrow function like "(value) => { ... }", the "this" keyword will be bound to the current context where you define
your function. You can access to the SPromise instance through the last parameter like so "(value, sPromiseInstance) => { ... }".

finally.name: finally
finally.description:
This method allows the SPromise user to register a function that will be called every time the "reject" one is called in the executor
The context of the callback will be the SPromise instance itself so you can call all the methods available like "resolve", "catch", etc using
the "this.resolve('something')" statusment. In an arrow function like "(value) => { ... }", the "this" keyword will be bound to the current context where you define
your function. You can access to the SPromise instance through the last parameter like so "(value, sPromiseInstance) => { ... }".

destroy.name: destroy
destroy.description: Destroying the SPromise instance by unregister all the callbacks, etc...

package.name: @coffeekraken/s-promise
package.description: As simple as a native Promise, this package extends it with events capabilities using the @coffeekraken/s-event-emitter one.

@coffeekraken.s-promise.SPromise.js.trea.name: treatAsValue
@coffeekraken.s-promise.SPromise.js.trea.description:
This function allows you to wrap a promise in a ```resolve``` call to prevent
this promise to be treated as a "chaining" promise but to be treated as
normal value passed in the resolve call.

package.name: @coffeekraken/s-promise
package.description: As simple as a native Promise, this package extends it with events capabilities using the @coffeekraken/s-event-emitter one.

@coffeekraken.s-promise.shared.interface.name: SPromiseSettingsInterface
@coffeekraken.s-promise.shared.interface.description: This class represent the interface that describe SPromise settings

treatCancelAs.description: Specify if a "cancel" event/call has to be treated like a "resolve", or like a "reject" a promise level

destroyTimeout.description: Specify after how many milliseconds the promise will be destroyed after a "finally" event

preventRejectOnThrow.description: Specify if you prefer your promise to be "resolved" when an underlying error is catched, or if is has to be rejected normally

emitLogErrorEventOnThrow.description: Specify if you want a "log" of type "error" to be emitted when an underlying error is catched

resolveAtResolveEvent.description: Specify if youw promise has to be resolved when catching a "resolve" event from deeper emitter

rejectAtRejectEvent.description: Specify if youw promise has to be rejected when catching a "reject" event from deeper emitter

resolveProxies.description: Specify some functions to be called just before resolving the promise. This function will take the current promise resolve value and must return the updated value

rejectProxies.description: Specify some functions to be called just before rejecting the promise. This function will take the current promise resolve value and must return the updated value

package.name: @coffeekraken/s-promise
package.description: As simple as a native Promise, this package extends it with events capabilities using the @coffeekraken/s-event-emitter one.

package.name: @coffeekraken/s-process
package.description: Powerful and easy to use class to generate "process" from a function, a command, a filepath that exports a function, etc... These "process" are promise based and can be executed in child process if wanted.

@coffeekraken.s-process.s-process.SComma.name: SCommandProcess
@coffeekraken.s-process.s-process.SComma.description: This class represent an SProcess started with a simple bash command like "ls -la" or whatever

process.name: process
process.description:
Run the actual command through a ```spawn``` call.
The spawn function used here is the sugar one stored in "sugar.node.process.spawn"

package.name: @coffeekraken/s-process
package.description: Powerful and easy to use class to generate "process" from a function, a command, a filepath that exports a function, etc... These "process" are promise based and can be executed in child process if wanted.

@coffeekraken.s-process.sugar.node.proce.name: SProcess
@coffeekraken.s-process.sugar.node.proce.description:
This class represent an SProcess run iteration that store things like
the value, the startTime, endTime, duration, state, etc...

stdio.name: stdio
stdio.description: Access the stdio class initiated if exists

executionsstack.name: executionsStack
executionsstack.description:
This array store each executions informations in separated objects
that store the duration, startTime, endTime, state, etc...

currentexecutionobj.name: currentExecutionObj
currentexecutionobj.description: Store the current execution object info like startTime, endTime, duration, state, etc...

paramsinterface.name: paramsInterface
paramsinterface.description:
Store the parameters interface to apply on the params object and on the initialParams object.
Can come from the static ```interfaces.params``` property or the ```settings.interface``` one.

from.name: from
from.description:
This static method allows you to pass arguments like:
- file path: Will require it, check what's returned from and instanciate an SProcess depending on that
- command string: Will instanciate a new SCommandProcess instance and returns it for you to run it
- function: Will execute the function and instanciate the proper SPromise instance type depending on the returned value
- SPromise instance: Will simply wrap the SPromise  instance inside an SProcess one and returns you this new SProcess instance
- SProcess based class: This make not so much sens but at least you can rely on this method to instanciate event an SProcess based class
Once you get the proper instance back, you can use it the same as an SProcess based class instance and use the ```run``` method to
execute your process

fromcommand.name: fromCommand
fromcommand.description:
Initialize an SCommandProcess instance on which you can call the standard "run" method
and execute a command by passing inside the params object the ```command``` prop.

run.name: run
run.description:
Run the process by calling the ```process``` method implemented on your
SProcess class (if exists).
Take care of starting timers for duration tracking, etc...

process.name: process
process.description:
This is the method you have to implement in you SProcess class. It will be called
when you call the ```run``` method with the params, etc...
You have to return an SPromise instance in order that the SProcess class is able to keep
track of your process state, logs, etc...

ready.name: ready
ready.description:
This method allows you to set the process in the "ready" state.
This will make the stdio initialize, etc...

kill.name: kill
kill.description:
This method will simply kill the process and call the "cancel" method
on the SPromise super instance as well as on the passed "promise" instance

cancel.name: cancel
cancel.description: This method allows you to cancel the process

isrunning.name: isRunning
isrunning.description: This method allows you to check if the process is currently running or not

isidle.name: isIdle
isidle.description: This method allows you to check if the process is currently idle or not

isready.name: isReady
isready.description: This method allows you to check if the process is currently ready or not

iskilled.name: isKilled
iskilled.description: This method allows you to check if the process has been killed or not

iserror.name: isError
iserror.description: This method allows you to check if the process is in error state or not

issuccess.name: isSuccess
issuccess.description: This method allows you to check if the process is in success state or not

log.name: log
log.description: This method allows you to log a message that will be catched by the parent manager class

error.name: error
error.description: This method allows you to error a message that will be catched by the parent manager class

- active: When the element has the "active" class or the "active" attribute

amountRotateX.description: Specify the amount of parallax you want for the rotate x axis. This will be applied on top of the global amount

amountRotateY.description: Specify the amount of parallax you want for the rotate y axis. This will be applied on top of the global amount

@coffeekraken.s-page-transition-feature..name: SPageTransitionFeature
@coffeekraken.s-page-transition-feature..description:
This feature allows you to add page transition to your size by using ajax requests and configurable
transition effects.

example.title: Simple example
example.code:
On your body tag, put the s-page-transition attribute

This website is a perfect example of this feature behavior...

This link will reload this same page using a page transition...

example.title: Update only a part of the page
example.code:
To update only a part of the UI, simply add the s-page-transition-container="something" on the part you want to be updated

If this same container exists in the loaded page, only this part will be updated.

This website is a perfect example of this feature behavior...

This link will reload this same page using a page transition...

patchBody.description: Specify if you want to patch the body tag with the new page body tag

scrollTop.description: Specify if you want to scroll to the top of the updated element after a transition

before.description: Specify a function to run before the transition

after.description: Specify a function to run after the transition

autoStyle.description: Specify if you want to automatically add classes like "s-tc:error" on the broken links (only the "a" tags)

injectBrokenLinkIcon.description: Specify if you want to inject the "error" icon on the broken links

brokenLinkIcon.description: Specify the icon you want to inject on the broken links

ga.description: Specify if you want to track pages change using google analytics of not. If true, will use the config.google.ga configuration as target, otherwise you can specify the gtag universal id here...

package.name: @coffeekraken/s-page-transition-feature
package.description: Handle your pages transition easily with automatically applying ajax requests on your links, as well as refreshing only the page section needed.

on the needs...

package.name: @coffeekraken/s-log
package.description: Simple base log class that mainly specify what a log object has to have like a "type" property. It also export a lot of static constants to make use in your code like the __SLog.TYPE_INFO, and more...

@coffeekraken.s-log.shared.SLog.name: SLog
@coffeekraken.s-log.shared.SLog.description:
This class represent a log that can be make across the application using the "emit"
function of an SPromise instance for example. It has as goal to centralize and harmonize
what a log can be and can do.
Each log is specified by some characteristic like a "type" that can be something like "SLog.LOG" or "SLog.WARN".
It has also the possibility to unactivate some logs depending on different cisronstances like for example the
fact to set the `SLog.filter([SLog.WARN, SLog.ERROR])` to only let the warn and error logs
activated.

type_log.name: TYPE_LOG
type_log.description: This static constant tells a log that it is of type "LOG"

type_info.name: TYPE_INFO
type_info.description: This static constant tells a log that it is of type "INFO"

type_warn.name: TYPE_WARN
type_warn.description: This static constant tells a log that it is of type "WARN"

type_error.name: TYPE_ERROR
type_error.description: This static constant tells a log that it is of type "ERROR"

type_verbose.name: TYPE_VERBOSE
type_verbose.description: This static constant tells a log that it is of type "VERBOSE"

type_verboser.name: TYPE_VERBOSER
type_verboser.description: This static constant tells a log that it is of type "VERBOSER"

type_decorator.name: TYPE_DECORATOR
type_decorator.description: This static constant tells a log that it is of type "DECORATOR"

type_summary.name: TYPE_SUMMARY
type_summary.description: This static constant tells a log that it is of type "SUMMARY"

type_child_process.name: TYPE_CHILD_PROCESS
type_child_process.description: This static constant tells a log that it is of type "CHILD_PROCESS"

types.name: TYPES
types.description: This static constant store all the log types available

preset_silent.name: PRESET_SILENT
preset_silent.description: This static constant define a log preset called "silent" that display nothing

preset_default.name: PRESET_DEFAULT
preset_default.description:
This static constant define a log preset called "default" that display:
- LOG
- INFO
- WARN
- ERROR
- DECORATOR
- SUMMARY

preset_warn.name: PRESET_WARN
preset_warn.description:
This static constant define a log preset called "warn" that display:
- WARN
- ERROR

preset_error.name: PRESET_ERROR
preset_error.description:
This static constant define a log preset called "error" that display:
- ERROR

preset_verbose.name: PRESET_VERBOSE
preset_verbose.description:
This static constant define a log preset called "verbose" that display:
- LOG
- INFO
- WARN
- ERROR
- VERBOSE
- DECORATOR
- SUMMARY

preset_verboser.name: PRESET_VERBOSER
preset_verboser.description:
This static constant define a log preset called "verboser" that display:
- LOG
- INFO
- WARN
- ERROR
- VERBOSE
- VERBOSER
- DECORATOR
- SUMMARY

presets.name: PRESETS
presets.description: This static constant store all the log presets available

filter.name: filter
filter.description:
This static method allows you to filter the logs across your entire app
at once. To do this, simply name your filter and pass an object describing
what you want to apply as filter.
These filters will have as consequence to set the "active" property of each logs to
true or false.

example.code: SLog.filter([SLog.TYPE_WARN, SLog.TYPE_ERROR]);

clearfilters.name: clearFilters
clearfilters.description: This static method allows you to reset all the filters applied

setdefaultlogobj.name: setDefaultLogObj
setdefaultlogobj.description:
This static method allows you to set a default log object
above every others will be extended.

istypeenabled.name: isTypeEnabled
istypeenabled.description:
This static method allows you Check if a particular log type is enabled or not.
You can pass as well multiple log types as an array.

value.name: value
value.description: Access the "value" property of the SLog object

type.name: type
type.description:
Access the "type" property of the SLog object
This specify which type if the log. LOG, INFO, WARN, ERROR or VERBODE

active.name: active
active.description:
Access the "active" property of the SLog object
This specify if the log is active depending on parameters like `SLog.filter`.
Check the documentation of this static method for more info.

decorators.name: decorators
decorators.description:
Access the "decorators" property of the SLog object.
This specify if the log has to be printed with decorators or not

time.name: time
time.description:
Access the "time" property of the SLog object.
This specify if the log has to be printed with his time or not

timestamp.name: timestamp
timestamp.description: Access the "timestamp" property of the SLog object

clear.name: clear
clear.description:
Access the "clear" property of the SLog object.
This specify if the previous logs have to be cleared before printing this one

margin.name: margin
margin.description: Access the "margin" property of the SLog object.

temp.name: temp
temp.description:
Access the "temp" property of the SLog object.
This specify if this log is a temporary one and if it has to be deleted
when the next log appear.

as.name: as
as.description:
Access the "as" property of the SLog object.
This specify the optimal way the log has to be displayed.
This depends on the logger you use and how it can display logs.

package.name: @coffeekraken/s-log
package.description: Simple base log class that mainly specify what a log object has to have like a "type" property. It also export a lot of static constants to make use in your code like the __SLog.TYPE_INFO, and more...

package.name: @coffeekraken/s-interface
package.description: Simple but powerful class that allowa you to define a schema that an object has to follow with default values, types, etc... You can then apply this interface on your objects and get back a complient result.

@coffeekraken.s-interface.s-interface.sh.name: getAvailableInterfaceTypes
@coffeekraken.s-interface.s-interface.sh.description: This function simply return an object with all the promoted as types interfaces.

package.name: @coffeekraken/s-interface
package.description: Simple but powerful class that allowa you to define a schema that an object has to follow with default values, types, etc... You can then apply this interface on your objects and get back a complient result.

@coffeekraken.s-interface.s-interface.sh.name: SInterface
@coffeekraken.s-interface.s-interface.sh.description:
This class allows you to define some rules that some object or instance
have to follow. You will be able to apply these rules and see what
does not fit correctly.

definition.name: definition
definition.description:
This property store all the SDescriptor rules that this interface
implements for each properties

registerrenderer.name: registerRenderer
registerrenderer.description:
This static method allows you to register a renderer that you can then
use through the ```interface.render('{rendererId}')``` interface method

mix.name: mix
mix.description: This static method allows you to mix multiple interfaces into one

overrie.name: overrie
overrie.description:
This static method is usefull to make a duplicate of the base interface with some updates
in the definition object.

isdefault.name: isDefault
isdefault.description: This static method allows you to check if a certain value is the default of a certain property or not.

getavailabletypes.name: getAvailableTypes
getavailabletypes.description:
This static method allows you to get the types that have been make widely available
using the ```makeAvailableAsType``` method.

makeavailableastype.name: makeAvailableAsType
makeavailableastype.description:
This static method allows you to promote your interface at the level where it can be
used in the "type" interface definition property like so "Object<MyCoolType>"

toobject.name: toObject
toobject.description: This function allows you to get back a simple object describing the interface

defaults.name: defaults
defaults.description: This function simply returns you the default interface values in object format

apply.name: apply
apply.description:
This method allows you to apply the interface on an object instance.
By default, if something is wrong in your class implementation, an error with the
description of what's wrong will be thrown. You can change that behavior if you prefer having
true returned when all is ok, or a string describing the current issue by specify the "settings.throw" property to false.

help.name: help
help.description:
This static method allows you to get back the help using the
passed renderer. Awailable rendered are for now:
- terminal (default): The default terminal renderer
- more to come depending on needs...

package.name: @coffeekraken/s-interface
package.description: Simple but powerful class that allowa you to define a schema that an object has to follow with default values, types, etc... You can then apply this interface on your objects and get back a complient result.

@coffeekraken.s-interface.sugar.node.int.name: SInterfaceRenderer
@coffeekraken.s-interface.sugar.node.int.description:
This class represent the base for every interface renderers.
It handle things like registering types templates, properties to exclude, etc...

id.name: id
id.description:
Store the id of the renderer.
This id has to be used when you call the ```interface.render('{id}', {})``` method of the SInterface instance.

render.name: render
render.description: This method simply render the passed interface

@coffeekraken.s-interface.sugar.js.inter.name: layout
@coffeekraken.s-interface.sugar.js.inter.description:
Return the layout you want for the "terminal" renderer.
You can use tokens like these:
- %type : Will be replaced with the "type" field rendered string
- %default : Same but for the "default" field
- etc...

glob.description: Specify a glob pattern relative to the "inDir" to target images you want to process

compressExts.description: Specify the file extensions you want to compress

inDir.description: Specify the absolute path to the folder where your images stands

outDir.description: Specify the absolute path to the folder you want to save your images. "inDir" folder structure is kept.

quality.description: Specify the quality percentage you want to target without the "%" sign

webp.description: Specify if you want to generate ".webp" versions of your images or not

width.description: Specify the maximum width you want to target for your images

height.description: Specify the maximum height you want to target for your images

resolution.description: Specify some resolutions you want to generate. The targeted "width" and "height" is considered as the resolution 1 and all others resolutions are declined from this

clear.description: Specify if you want to clear the "outDir" before generate new images or not

specificParams.description: Allows you to specify some custom params depending on folder globs like "myCoolFolder/*.jpg" used as object property. Override every settings you want in this new object for the specified folder(s)
