copysync.name: copySync
copysync.description:
This method allows you to specify a glob to select files as well as an output directory where to put these files in.
Note that the settings.cwd will be used to create the relative to outDir pathes.

match.name: match
match.description:
Check if the passed string match the passed glob pattern(s).
This make use of the AWESOME micromatch library.

extractglob.name: extractGlob
extractglob.description: This function simply return you the glob part of the glob(s) passed in constructor

extractnoneglob.name: extractNoneGlob
extractnoneglob.description: This function simply return you the none glob part of the glob(s) passed in constructor

package.name: @coffeekraken/s-form-validate-feature
package.description: Powerful feature that you can use to validate your form inputs using rules like "password", "min", "email", and a lot more...

@coffeekraken.s-form-validate-feature.js.name: SFormValidateFeature
@coffeekraken.s-form-validate-feature.js.description:
This package expose a simple `SFormValidateFeature` class that allows you to validate
your forms before sending them to your backend.

example.title: Password
Nodes
Email field
Alphanumeric field
Credit card field
Min / Max
Select field
Select min / max
Custom error message
ISO date field
Range min / max
Format
Checkboxes min / max
Submit / Reset

min.description: Validate string, array, object and number using the "min" rule

max.description: Validate string, array, object and number using the "max" rule

required.description: Make sure a value has been provided

pattern.description: Validate a string using a regex pattern

minMessage.description: The message to display when the validator "min" fails

maxMessage.description: The message to display when the validator "max" fails

emailMessage.description: The message to display when the validator "email" fails

requiredMessage.description: The message to display when the validator "required" fails

isoDateMessage.description: The message to display when the validator "isoDate" fails

isoTimeMessage.description: The message to display when the validator "isoTime" fails

isoDateTimeMessage.description: The message to display when the validator "isoDateTime" fails

integerMessage.description: The message to display when the validator "integer" fails

numberMessage.description: The message to display when the validator "number" fails

negativeMessage.description: The message to display when the validator "negative" fails

positiveMessage.description: The message to display when the validator "positive" fails

patternMessage.description: The message to display when the validator "pattern" fails

alphanumMessage.description: The message to display when the validator "alphanum" fails

creditCardMessage.description: The message to display when the validator "creditCard" fails

colorMessage.description: The message to display when the validator "color" fails

hexMessage.description: The message to display when the validator "hex" fails

passwordMessage.description: The message to display when the validator "password" fails

type.description: Specify the validation type. Usually automatically detected depending on the field type

on.description: Specify when to trigger a validation. Can be "change","submit","enter" and/or "reset"

format.description: Specify if you want your value to be formatted a certain way. You can specify every "import { __format } from `@coffeekraken/sugar/string`" supported formats

errorClass.description: Specify the class to apply when theres an error

validClass.description: Specify the class to apply on your s-form-validate element when validation is passed successfully

handlers.description: Specify some custom handlers by validator that will be executed in addition to the default validate behavior. The handler will take as argument an object containing the "result" SValidator result, the "$feature" that represent the s-validate node, the "$form" node if exists, the "$node" attached node if using the "nodes" property, the "$field" that represent the input field handled and the "props" that represent the feature properties

nodes.description: Specify a css selector that target some HTMLElements used for the validation. Every HTMLElement has to specify 1 validator by using element attributes (same as on the feature itself). Classes are applied on each "node" to specify if the validator is valid or not

language.description: Specify the language you want to use for messages

displayError.description: Specify if you want to display the error messages or not

errorContainerAttr.description: Specify the attribute to search for the error container. If not found, a default container will be created and inserted after your s-form-validate element

This feature allows you to put your floating UI elements like tooltips, etc, under steroid using the
AMAZING [Floating UI](https://floating-ui.com) package.

example.title: Email field
example.code:
Floating element preview. Try to scroll...
I'm the floating element

ref.description: Specify the reference HTMLElement from which to position the floating one. If not specified, will take the previous element in the DOM

position.description: Specify the placement of your floating element. By default it will try to be placed as good as possible.

shift.description: Specify a space between the floating element and the viewport side to respect

offset.description: Specify a space between the floating element and the reference one to respect

arrow.description: Specify if you want an arrow or not

arrowSize.description: Specify the size of the arrow in px

arrowPadding.description: Specify the padding of the arrow in px

package.name: @coffeekraken/s-filtrable-input-component
package.description: Powerful web component that let you create simple and complexe filtrable input like search completion, etc...

@coffeekraken.s-filtrable-input-componen.name: SFiltrableInputComponent
@coffeekraken.s-filtrable-input-componen.description: This component represent a filtrable input to display and filter a list of items easily.

example.title: Simple example
example.code:
<template id="items">
  [{"title":"Hello","value":"hello"},{"title":"world","value":"world"}]
</template>
<s-filtrable-input items="#items" label="title" filtrable="title">
  <input type="text" class="s-input" placeholder="Type something..." />
</s-filtrable-input>

import { define } from '@coffeekraken/s-filtrable-input-component';
define();

example.title: Custom templates and items
example.code:
<my-cool-filtrable-input>
   <input type="text" class="s-input" placeholder="Type something..." />
</my-cool-filtrable-input>

items.description: Specify an array of items to use in your filtrable list. Can be a JSON string, a function that take an object with the "value" property and must return an array of items to use

value.description: Specify the attribute in your items to use as a value. Can be also a function that will be called with an object containing the selected item and must return the string you want to use as value

label.description: Specify the attribute in your items to use as a label. Can be also a function that will be called with an object containing the selected item and must return the string you want to use as label

emptyText.description: Specify the text to use for the default "empty" (no result) state

searchValuePreprocess.description: Specify a function used to preprocess the value just before actually searching through the items

loadingText.description: Specify the text to use for the default "loading" state

filter.description: Specify a function to use to filter the items. Must return the filtered list of items

filtrable.description: Specify all the properties of your "item" to use as source for the filtrable process

showKeywords.description: Specify if you want to display the "keywords" section on top of the list results

templates.description: Specify either an object with properties like "item", "empty" and "loading", or a function returning the good template depending on tne "type" argument property

closeTimeout.description: Specify the duration before closing the list when having selected an item

interactive.description: Specify if your items in the list are interactive or not to let the user click and interact with them

closeOnSelect.description: Specify if you wantr to close the list when selecting an item

resetOnSelect.description: Specify if you want your filtrable input to be reseted on select

notSelectable.description: Specify if you want the items to be not selectable

maxItems.description: Specify the maximum number of items to display at first in the list

classes.description: Specify some additional classes to add to the component elements

inline.description: Specify if you want the filterable input list to be always displayed and inline in the html

define.name: define
define.description:
This function allows you to define (register) your custom element with some default
props if needed.

@coffeekraken.s-file.config.sFile.classe.name: classesMap

package.name: @coffeekraken/s-file
package.description: Simple and convinient class that allows you to represent a file on your system and access his stats easily as well as manipulate (read,write,remove,etc...) it.

package.name: @coffeekraken/s-file
package.description: Simple and convinient class that allows you to represent a file on your system and access his stats easily as well as manipulate (read,write,remove,etc...) it.

@coffeekraken.s-file.node.fs.SFile.name: SFile
@coffeekraken.s-file.node.fs.SFile.description:
This class represent a file in the filesystem. With it you can simply instanciate one by passing the file path,
and get access to all the nice meta data like:
- name: The file name
- path: The full path to the file
- cwd: The root directory specified through the settings.cwd property
- relPath: The relative file path from the cwd
- dirPath: The path to the folder where is the file
- extension: The file extension
- stats: An object with file stats like size in mb, kb, etc...
- exists: true if the file exists on the disk, false otherwise

registerclass.name: registerClass
registerclass.description:
This method allows you to register an SFile(...) class with an extension
to allows you to instanciate the best one using the ```new``` static
method.

sourcesfiles.name: sourcesFiles
sourcesfiles.description: Store the sources files found using the specified sourcesExtensions in the settings

new.name: new
new.description:
This function take as parameter a file path and an object of settings
to instanciate the proper SFile(...) class depending on the file extension.
If the extension does not correspond to any registered SFile(...) class,
the file will be instanciated using the SFile class itself.

To register a new SFile(...) class mapping, use the ```registerClass``` static
method.

name.name: name
name.description: Store the full file name

namewithoutext.name: nameWithoutExt
namewithoutext.description: Store the file name without the extension

path.name: path
path.description:
Store the full file path
Some tokens can be used in the file path like:
- %packageTmpDir: return the absolute path to the package tmp directory
- %packageLocalDir: return the absolute path to the package .local directory
- %packageCacheDir: return the absolute path to the package cache directory
- %packageRootDir: return the absolute path to the package root directory

- %srcRootDir: return the absolute path to the source root directory
- %srcJsDir: return the absolute path to the source js directory
- %srcCssDir: return the absolute path to the source css directory
- %srcIconsDir: return the absolute path to the source icons directory
- %srcImgDir: return the absolute path to the source images directory
- %srcNodeDir: return the absolute path to the source node directory
- %srcViewsDir: return the absolute path to the source views directory

- %distRootDir: return the absolute path to the dist root directory
- %distJsDir: return the absolute path to the dist js directory
- %distCssDir: return the absolute path to the dist css directory
- %distIconsDir: return the absolute path to the dist icons directory
- %distImgDir: return the absolute path to the dist images directory
- %distNodeDir: return the absolute path to the dist node directory
- %distViewsDir: return the absolute path to the dist views directory

cwd.name: cwd
cwd.description:
Store the root directory where the file actually lives.
The root directory can be for example ```src/js``` for a file that lives under ```/my/cool/path/src/js/array/sort.js```.
To set this property, you need to pass the ```cwd``` setting through the constructor...

exists.name: exists
exists.description: Specify if the file exists on the filesystem or not

events.name: events
events.description: Store the SEventEmitter instance through which you can listen for events like "update", etc...

relpath.name: relPath
relpath.description:
Store the path relative to the ```cwd``` property. To have access to this property, you MUST
specify the settings.cwd through the constructor

dirpath.name: dirPath
dirpath.description: Store the path to the folder where the file lives

stats.name: stats
stats.description: Access the file stats like the updated timestamp, sizes, etc...

raw.name: raw
raw.description: Access the raw file content in string format

commits.name: commits
commits.description: Store all the commits made before saving the file

toobject.name: toObject
toobject.description: This method transform this instance into a plain object

watch.name: watch
watch.description: This method allows you to start watching the file for events like "update", etc...

unwatch.name: unwatch
unwatch.description: This method allows you to stop the watching process of the file

tostring.name: toString
tostring.description: Return the string version of the file. Here, the path...

duplicate.name: duplicate
duplicate.description:
This method allows you to make a copy of this file.
If you don't specify a "to" path, the file will be diplicated
into the temp directory

duplicatesync.name: duplicateSync
duplicatesync.description:
This method allows you to make a copy of this file.
If you don't specify a "to" path, the file will be diplicated
into the temp directory

save.name: save
save.description:
This method allows you to save the file with the content
that you can set by setting the ```content``` property

savesync.name: saveSync
savesync.description:
This method allows you to save the file with the content
that you can set by setting the ```content``` property

unlink.name: unlink
unlink.description: This method allows you to unlink the file asyncronously

unlinksync.name: unlinkSync
unlinksync.description: This method allows you to unlinkSync the file syncronously

read.name: read
read.description: This method allows you to read the file asycronously

readsync.name: readSync
readsync.description: This method allows you to read the file syncronously

write.name: write
write.description: This method allows you to write the file asycronously

writesync.name: writeSync
writesync.description: This method allows you to write the file sycronously

package.name: @coffeekraken/s-file
package.description: Simple and convinient class that allows you to represent a file on your system and access his stats easily as well as manipulate (read,write,remove,etc...) it.

@coffeekraken.s-file.node.interface.SFil.name: SFileSettingsInterface
@coffeekraken.s-file.node.interface.SFil.description: This class represent the interface that describe SFile settings

checkExistence.description: Specify if the file must exists on the filesystem at the instanciation

shrinkSizeTo.description: Specify how many decimals to keep for the size

watch.description: Specify if you want to watch the file for changes or not

processors.description: Specify some functions to execute on the file content before accessing the "content", and saving it "save". Each "content" and "save" property stores an Array of functions that will be executed once after the other

package.name: @coffeekraken/s-file
package.description: Simple and convinient class that allows you to represent a file on your system and access his stats easily as well as manipulate (read,write,remove,etc...) it.

package.name: @coffeekraken/s-feature
package.description: Base class to use to create features like @coffeekraken/s-activate-feature, etc... It handle properties as well as mounting at a certain point time, default properties and more...

@coffeekraken.s-feature.shared.SFeature.name: SFeature
@coffeekraken.s-feature.shared.SFeature.description:
This class allows you to create "features". Feature is like webcomponent but does not provide a
custom HTML tag.

name.name: name
name.description: Store the feature name

setdefaultprops.name: setDefaultProps
setdefaultprops.description:
This static method allows you to set some default props for some particular
component(s). You can target components using simple css selectorl like "my-component#cool".
Once the component is instanciated, it will check if some defaults are specified and
extends them with the passed props.

define.name: define
define.description:
This static method allows you to register a new feature
associated with an HTMLElement attribute like "s-activate", etc...

beforepropchange.name: beforePropChange
beforepropchange.description:
This method allows you to catch a property change before it actually occurs.
You can return the value to set it as it is, return another value to set another one
or returns undefined to prevent the change to be commited.

afterpropchanged.name: afterPropChanged
afterpropchanged.description: This method allows you to catch properties updates AFTER it has been commited.

mount.name: mount
mount.description:
This method allows you to actually mount your feature behavior.
It will be called depending on the "mountWhen" setting setted.

package.name: @coffeekraken/s-feature
package.description: Base class to use to create features like @coffeekraken/s-activate-feature, etc... It handle properties as well as mounting at a certain point time, default properties and more...

package.name: @coffeekraken/s-event-emitter
package.description: Powerful event system for node that let you dispatch events, pipe them upper or to different emitters as well as subscribe to them with glob like support.

example.code: import SEventEmitter from '@coffeekraken/sugar/js/event/SEventEmitter';

global.name: global
global.description:
This static property store a global event emitter instance that you can use to
communicate between processes with ease or simply into a same process
between all of your running things

pipe.name: pipe
pipe.description:
This method is the same as the ```pipe```and ```pipeFrom``` one but it's just act as the inverse.
Here you specify whenre you want to pipe this instance events and not from which you want to pipe them here...

bind.name: bind
bind.description: This method allows you to bind another object as the emitter.

pipeerrors.name: pipeErrors
pipeerrors.description: This is the exact same as the original ```pipe``` method. It's just pipe only the errors.

pipefrom.name: pipeFrom
pipefrom.description: This is the exacte same as the original ```pipe``` method. It's just an aliasw.

start.name: start
start.description:
This method has to be called when you want to start the event emissions.
This is usefull only if you set the setting ```asyncStart``` to true.
Untill you call this method, all the emitted events
are store in memory and emitted after.

emit.name: emit
emit.description: This is the method that allows you to emit the callbacks like "catch", "finally", etc... without actually resolving the Promise itself

on.name: on
on.description:
This method allows the SEventEmitter user to register a function that will be called every time the "resolve" one is called in the executor
The context of the callback will be the SEventEmitter instance itself so you can call all the methods available like "resolve", "release", "on", etc using
the "this.resolve('something')" statusment. In an arrow function like "(value) => { ... }", the "this" keyword will be bound to the current context where you define
your function. You can access to the SEventEmitter instance through the last parameter like so "(value, SEventEmitterInstance) => { ... }".

off.name: off
off.description:
This method allows you to unsubscribe to an event by passing the event name an optionally the callback function.
If you don't pass the callback function, all the subscribed events the same as the passed one will be unsubscribed.

destroy.name: destroy
destroy.description: Destroying the SEventEmitter instance by unregister all the callbacks, etc...

package.name: @coffeekraken/s-event-emitter
package.description: Powerful event system for node that let you dispatch events, pipe them upper or to different emitters as well as subscribe to them with glob like support.

@coffeekraken.s-event-emitter.shared.int.name: SEventEmitterPipeSettingsInterface
@coffeekraken.s-event-emitter.shared.int.description: This class represent the interface that describe SEventEmitter.pipe settings

events.description: Specify some events to pipe. Default it pipe everything using `*`

overrideEmitter.description: Specify if the emitter of the event that will be piped has to be overrided by the instance that pipe the event

processor.description: Specify a function that will be called before piping the event value. If you return only 1 value, it will set the value only, otherwise you can return an object with `value` and `metas` property to update also the metas

exclude.description: Specify some event(s) to not pipe at all like `resolve`, `reject`, etc...

filter.description: Specify a function that will receive the value and the metas object and MUST return `true` or `false` to tell if you want to pipe this current event

package.name: @coffeekraken/s-event-emitter
package.description: Powerful event system for node that let you dispatch events, pipe them upper or to different emitters as well as subscribe to them with glob like support.

@coffeekraken.s-event-emitter.shared.int.name: SEventEmitterSettingsInterface
@coffeekraken.s-event-emitter.shared.int.description: This class represent the interface that describe SEventEmitter settings

asyncStart.description: Specify if you want to start the event emitting process by yourself using the `start()` method

bufferTimeout.description: Specify how many ms to wait when the emitter is started to emit the buffered events

defaults.description: Specify some default object values for events. The property define the event name (of minimatch pattern) and the value is the default that will be applied at each emit

castByEvent.description: Specify a class by event name in which the value will be casted automatically. For example, the "log" event value is casted into an SLog instance

bind.description: Specify another object that will be used as the event emitter in the events metas. This do the same as using the `emitter.bind(...)` method

package.name: @coffeekraken/s-event-emitter
package.description: Powerful event system for node that let you dispatch events, pipe them upper or to different emitters as well as subscribe to them with glob like support.

@coffeekraken.s-env.config.env.env.name: env
@coffeekraken.s-env.config.env.env.description:
Specify the environment env. This is usually "production" or "dev" as value.
If undefined, will be determined depending on the platform.
For node, it will take the process.env.NODE_ENV variable
For browser, if not specified manually, it will depends on the "env.envFromLocation" configuration to determine the correct environment using regex check

@coffeekraken.s-duration.shared.SDuratio.name: SDuration
@coffeekraken.s-duration.shared.SDuratio.description:
This class represent a duration tracking process. Simply instanciate it,
then call the ```instance.get()``` method and you will get back
the duration between the instanciation and the ```get``` method call

toobject.name: toObject
toobject.description:
This method end the duration if needed and return an object with these properties:
- startTime: the start timestamp
- endTime: the end timestamp
- duration: the duration in miliseconds
- formatedDuration: the duration formated

start.name: start
start.description: Start the duration process either with the current timestamp, or with a passed timestamp you prefer

end.name: end
end.description: Stop the duration counter and return the result in the passed format or in the format setted in the settings

@coffeekraken.s-dropzone-component.js.SD.name: SDropzoneComponent

example.title: Copy from an input
example.code: <s-dropzone action="/upload"></s-dropzone>

maxFiles.description: Specify the maximum files that can be droped on the dropzone at once

maxSize.description: Specify the maximum file size accepted by the dropzone

files.description: Specify some initial file(s) to be used and displayed in the UI. MUST contain at least a "src" attribute by file passed

accept.description: Specify which file types are accepted. Exactly the same as the "accept" attribute of the input[type="file"]

input.description: Specify if you want an input[type="file"] or not

name.description: Specify a name for the input[type="file"] input that will be created if you set the "input" property to true

upload.description: Specify if you want the droped file(s) to be uploaded or not

uploadUrl.description: Specify the url where to upload the file(s)

errorTimeout.description: Specify how many ms the error class is applied on the dropzone when something goes wrong

helpIcon.description: Specify the html to be used for the "help" icon

dropFileIcon.description: Specify the html to be used for the "drop" icon when no file have been droped

i18n.description: Specify some words/sentences to be translated

This is the main class that expose the methods like "parse", etc...
You have to instanciate it by passing a settings object. Here's the available options:

sort.name: sort
sort.description:
This method allows you to set the order in which you want to get the
blocks back when using the methods like get blocks, etc...

parse.name: parse
parse.description:
This method is the principal one. Use it to parse a string
and get back the object version of it

toobject.name: toObject
toobject.description: This method convert the parsed docblocks to a simple object

tostring.name: toString
tostring.description: This method allows you to get the string version of the docblock(s)

package.name: @coffeekraken/s-docblock
package.description: Powerful class that let you parse docblocks with some registered tags like "name", "author", and a lot more...

@coffeekraken.s-docblock.shared.SDocbloc.description:
This class represent a docblock object that contains all the "tags" values and some features like:
- Converting the block to markdown
- More to come...

tagsmap.name: tagsMap
tagsmap.description: Store the default tags mapping to their parsing functions

registertag.name: registerTag
registertag.description:
This static method allows you to register a new tag that will
be recognized by the SDocblockBlock class.

tostring.name: toString
tostring.description: This method return the passed source string

toobject.name: toObject
toobject.description: This method return the parsed docblock object

@coffeekraken.s-docblock.sugar.node.docb.description:
This function search in the passed folder for files containing a "@namespace" tag (and an "@name" optional one)
and generate a SNav instance with all these founded files as sources...

example.code:
import firstDocblockWithNamespaceInFolder from '@coffeekraken/sugar/node/nav/firstDocblockWithNamespaceInFolder';
firstDocblockWithNamespaceInFolder('my/cool/folder');

package.name: @coffeekraken/s-datetime-picker-component
package.description: Clean datetime picker web component that support all ISO formats as well as dates|weekend|... disabling, and more...

@coffeekraken.s-datetime-picker-componen.name: SDatetimePickerComponent
@coffeekraken.s-datetime-picker-componen.description:
This component specify a datetime picker. It make uses of (this package)[https://www.npmjs.com/package/date-format-parse] behind the scene to
parse and format dates.

example.title: Simple input
With a calendar
With a backdrop
With a different format and a calendar
Just a button with disabled weekend
Disabled
RTL Support

name.description: Specify the name that will be assigned to the injected input if you don't provide one yourself

value.description: Specify the initial value for your picker

updateInput.description: Specify when you want to updat the attached input. Can be "pointermove", "pointerup", "pointerdown", "input", "validate", "close"

format.description: Specify the format of the color you want as end in the input value. Can be "hex", "hexa", "rgb", "rgba", "hsl" or "hsla"

inline.description: Specify if you want to initalize the color picker inline or if you want it to be displayed only when the focus is in the input

calendar.description: Specify if you want to display a calendar or not

i18n.description: Specify some translations for the color picker. You can translate the "reset", "clear" and "validate" buttons

placeholder.description: Specify the placeholder that will be assigned to the injected input if you don't provide one yourself

floatSettings.description: Specify some float settings to pass to the "makeFloat" function of the sugar toolkit

copyIconClass.description: Specify the class you want to apply on the "i" that display the "copy" icon

copiedIconClass.description: Specify the class you want to apply on the "i" that display the "copy" icon when the color has been copied

buttonIconClass.description: Specify the class you want to apply on the injected button icon

backdropClass.description: Specify the class to apply on the backdrop when the "backdrop" prop is true

disable.description: Specify what you want to disable. It can be "weekend", "week" or "2022-12-19" (dates)

disabled.description: Specify if the color picker is disabled

backdrop.description: Specify if you want the ".s-backdrop" element or not

actions.description: Specify the actions buttons you want to display. Can be "clear", "reset" and "validate". If false, hide all button

hours.description: Specify the hours you want in the time selector

minutes.description: Specify the minutes you want in the time selector

fromYear.description: Specify the first year to allow selection from

toYear.description: Specify the last year to allow selection from

package.description: Simple and powerful config loading|management|access class. Support adapters like @coffeekraken/s-config-folder-adapter, and more...

@coffeekraken.s-config.s-config.shared.c.name: config
@coffeekraken.s-config.s-config.shared.c.description:
This class allows you to quickly access/update some configuration depending on the data adapters specified.
The base available data adapters are:
- For node:
- File system adapter: @coffeekraken/s-config/src/node/adapters/SConfigFsAdapter
- For js:
- Localstorage adapter: @coffeekraken/s-config/src/js/adapters/SConfigLsAdapter

registerpostprocess.name: registerPostprocess
registerpostprocess.description: This method allows you to register a postprocess function that will be fired once the config is ready so you can make updates as needed

registerpreprocess.name: registerPreprocess
registerpreprocess.description: This method allows you to register a preprocess function that will be fired once the config is ready so you can make updates as needed

constructor.name: constructor
constructor.description: Init the config instance by passing a name and a settings object to configure your instance

load.name: load
load.description: Load the config from the default adapter or from the passed adapter

example.code: const config = await config.load();

fromcache.name: fromCache
fromcache.description: Get the config from cache if possible. Otherwise it will resolve to undefined

example.code: await config.fromCache();

cache.name: cache
cache.description: Save the config in the cache to load it faster next time

example.code: await config.cache();

get.name: get
get.description: Get a config depending on the dotted object path passed and either using the first registered adapter found, or the passed one

example.code: await config.get('log.frontend.mail.host'); // => gmail.google.com

set.name: set
set.description: Set a config depending on the dotted object path passed and the value to set

example.code: await config.get('log.frontend.mail.host'); // => gmail.google.com

toobject.name: toObject
toobject.description: This method allows you to get the config in a simple object format

tojson.name: toJson
tojson.description: This method allows you to get the config in a simple json object format

package.name: @coffeekraken/s-conductor
package.description: Class that let you register things to do at a certain point in time. It can be "inViewport", "nearViewport", "visible", and more...

@coffeekraken.s-conductor.s-duration.SCo.name: SConductor
@coffeekraken.s-conductor.s-duration.SCo.description:
This class represent the conductor for your UI. With it you can register some "task" to execute
at a specific time. The "times" available are these ones:

- direct: Execute directly the task
- directly: Execute directly the task
- inViewport: Execute when the element enter the viewport
- nearViewport: Execute when the element is near the viewport
- outOfViewport: Execute when the element is out of the viewport
- domReady: Execute when the DOM is ready
- visible: Execute when the element became visible
- stylesheetsReady: Execute when the stylesheets are ready
- interact: Execute when the user interact with the element. See the [whenInteract API documentation](/api/@coffeekraken.sugar.js.dom.detect.whenInteract).
- idle: Execute when no other task is running

defaultinstance.name: defaultInstance
defaultinstance.description: Access the default instance of the SConductor class

when.name: when
when.description: This method allows you to register a task to execute at a specific time in the "default" conductor instance.

setup.name: setup
setup.description: This static method allows you to setup the "default" SConductor instance created when you use the static methods like "when", etc...

package.name: @coffeekraken/s-conductor

id.description: Specify an id for your component

status.description: Specify the status of the component. Can be "pending", "mounting" or "mounted"

mountWhen.description: Specify when your component will be mounted

adoptStyle.description: Specify if your component adopt the style of the global DOM. This worts only if you are using a shadowRoot element

saveState.description: Specify if you want to save the state of your component

lnf.description: Specify the lnf (look-and-feel) of your component. This is used by the css to style your component

responsive.description: Specify some responsive properties. A "media" property is required and has to be either a media query, or a media query name defined in the config.themeMedia.queries theme setting

prefixEvent.description: Specify if you want the emitted events to be prefixed by the name of the feature/component like "s-slider.change" or not

verbose.description: Specify if you want this component/feature to log informations about activity or not

package.name: @coffeekraken/s-color
package.description: Clean and powerful class to handle colors. You can convert your color in and formats, manipulate it by desaturate it or whatever as well as access each properties of the color like "h", "s", "l", etc...

@coffeekraken.s-color.shared.SColor.name: SColor
@coffeekraken.s-color.shared.SColor.description:
Class that provide complete and simple to use color manupilation capabilities like:
- Modifiers
- lighten
- darken
- saturate
- desaturate
- spin (change hue)
- alpha
- opacity
- grayscale
- Conversions
- rgb
- rgba
- hsl
- hsla
- hex
- Print out formats
- toRgbString
- toRgbaString
- toHslString
- toHslaString
- toHexString
- toString(format = null)

getcolor.name: getColor
getcolor.description:
This method take as parameter the passed color to the constructor and has to return the
actual real color like color from the static colors listed in the SColor class or maybe
from the Sugar configured colors

example.code: myColor.toHex();
myColor.toHexa();
myColor.toHsl();
myColor.toHsla();
myColor.toRgb();
myColor.toRgba();

myColor.r;
myColor.r = 128;

myColor.g;
myColor.g = 20;

myColor.b;
myColor.b = 30;

myColor.a;
myColor.a = 20;

myColor.h;
myColor.h = 30;

myColor.s;
myColor.s = 20;

myColor.l;
myColor.l = 10;
myColor.clone();
myColor.reset();

apply.name: apply
apply.description:
This method allows you to apply some updated to your color
using the parameters defined in the SColorApplyInterface like
for example "saturate", "desaturate", etc...

example.code: myColor.desaturate(20);
myColor.saturate(20);

grayscale.name: grayscale
grayscale.description: Return a new SColor instance of the color to grayscale

example.code: myColor.grayscale();

spin.name: spin
spin.description: Spin the hue on the passed value (max 360)

example.code: myColor.spin(230);
myColor.alpha(10);
myColor.darken(20);
myColor.lighten(20);

invert.name: invert
invert.description: Calculate the best color value that will have the best contrast ratio

toobject.name: toObject
toobject.description: To simple json object. This object can be injected in the constructor to recover the same color

example.code: myColor.toObject();
myColor.toHexString();
myColor.toHexaString();
myColor.toRgbString();
myColor.toRgbaString();
myColor.toHslString();
myColor.toHslaString();
myColor.toString();

package.name: @coffeekraken/s-color-picker-component
package.description: Clean color picker web component that support hsl(a)|rgb(a)|hex(a) formats as well as touchscreen and color "eyedropper".

@coffeekraken.s-color-picker-component.j.name: SColorPickerComponent
@coffeekraken.s-color-picker-component.j.description:
This component specify a color picker. It uses under the hood the **AMAZING Pickr library** with some additional features like
sugar theming support as well as some events and more.
Almost all the Pickr options are available through properties. Check out the api documentation for more details...

example.title: With a different format (hsla)
Just a button
Disabled
RTL Support

name.description: Specify the name that will be assigned to the injected input if you don't provide one yourself

value.description: Specify the initial value for your picker

updateInput.description: Specify when you want to updat the attached input. Can be "pointermove", "pointerup", "pointerdown", "input", "validate", "close"

format.description: Specify the format of the color you want as end in the input value. Can be "hex", "hexa", "rgb", "rgba", "hsl" or "hsla"

inline.description: Specify if you want to initalize the color picker inline or if you want it to be displayed only when the focus is in the input

i18n.description: Specify some translations for the color picker. You can translate the "reset", "clear" and "validate" buttons

placeholder.description: Specify the placeholder that will be assigned to the injected input if you don't provide one yourself

backdrop.description: Specify if you want the ".s-backdrop" element or not

eyeDropper.description: Specify if you want the eye dropper capability to pick a color anywhere on the screen or not

actions.description: Specify the actions buttons you want to display. Can be "clear", "reset" and "validate". If false, hide all button

floatSettings.description: Specify some float settings to pass to the "makeFloat" function of the sugar toolkit

eyeDropperIconClass.description: Specify the class you want to apply on the "i" that display the "eyeDropper" icon

copyIconClass.description: Specify the class you want to apply on the "i" that display the "copy" icon

copiedIconClass.description: Specify the class you want to apply on the "i" that display the "copy" icon when the color has been copied

buttonIconClass.description: Specify the class you want to apply on the injected button icon

backdropClass.description: Specify the class to apply on the backdrop when the "backdrop" prop is true

disabled.description: Specify if the color picker is disabled

@coffeekraken.s-code-example-component.j.name: SCodeExampleComponent
@coffeekraken.s-code-example-component.j.description: This component represent a code example that make sure your passed code(s) is displayed well using under the hood the AMAZING [highlightjs](https://highlightjs.org/) library.

example.code:
<s-code-example>
     <template lang="js">
function $initHighlight(block, cls) {
try {
  if (cls.search(/\bno\-highlight\b/) != -1)
    return process(block, true, 0x0F) +
           ` class="${cls}"`;
} catch (e) {
}
for (var i = 0 / 2; i < classes.length; i++) {
  if (checkCondition(classes[i]) === undefined)
    console.log('undefined');
}
     </template>
</s-code-example>

import { define } from '@coffeekraken/s-code-example-component';
define();

@coffeekraken.s-carpenter.sugar.style.ui.description:
These classes represent all the icons that you have listed in your project using the @sugar.icon.classes mixin.
By using this mixin, your icons will be accessible using the same s-icon:{name} classes
independently of the icon source that can be *Fontawesome** or your **Filesystem**.
These providers are the one that we support for now but others can be added if needed.

@coffeekraken.s-bench.shared.SBench.name: SBench
@coffeekraken.s-bench.shared.SBench.description:
This class allows you to perform some simple benchmarking actions
like dividing a process into multiple "steps" and track the timing
between these, etc...

disable.name: disable
disable.description: This method allows you to disable the bench in you process

isdisabled.name: isDisabled
isdisabled.description: This method allows you to check if the bench are disabled in your process or not

stats.name: stats
stats.description: This method allows you to log some stats about the gathered benches

start.name: start
start.description: This method allows you to start a new bench "session"

step.name: step
step.description:
This method allows you to declare a new step in your bench.
A step is simple a point in your code like "after compilation", etc.
It will keep track of each steps and display the time it has taken
from the last step.

end.name: end
end.description: This method allows you to end a bencvh "session"

log.name: log
log.description: This method allows you to log the summary if this bench is active

tostring.name: toString
tostring.description: This method allows you to print the bench in string format

@coffeekraken.s-appear-feature.js.SAppea.name: SAppearFeature
@coffeekraken.s-appear-feature.js.SAppea.description:
This feature allows you to make some elements appear when it enter the viewport with different
apparition animation as well as custom one depending on your needs.

example.title: Bottom
example.code: I'm the appear element

example.title: Top
example.code: I'm the appear element

example.title: Right
example.code: I'm the appear element

example.title: Left
example.code: I'm the appear element

in.description: Specify the animation you want to use to display your element

out.description: Specify the animation you want to use to hide your item

delay.description: Specify a delay before animation in or out your element. Can be an array of two number that define the min delay and the max delay. The real delay will be random between these two numbers

duration.description: Specify the duration of the animation in ms. Can be an array of two number that define the min delay and the max duration. The real duration will be random between these two numbers

distance.description: Specify the distance that your element will move if you have set an "in" direction. Can be an array of two number that define the min delay and the max distance. The real duration will be random between these two numbers

appear.description: Specify if the element has to appear. This is usually setted automatically when needed

package.name: @coffeekraken/s-appear-feature
package.description: Nice and clean feature that let you make any HTMLElement appear from a certain direction when your element enters the viewport.

package.name: @coffeekraken/s-activate-feature
package.description: Simple but powerful feature that let you (un)activate targets on events like "click", "mouseover", "anchor", etc... All of this with controls like grouping to create tabs, handle history or event save state.

@coffeekraken.s-activate-feature.js.SAct.name: SActivateFeature
@coffeekraken.s-activate-feature.js.SAct.description:
This feature allows you to activate some elements depending on triggers like `click`, `mouseover`, `mouseout`, `anchor`, etc...
To be explicit, you can apply this feature on a link tag with the href attribute `#something`, and on click,
the DOM element that has the id "something" will get the "active" class applied.

example.title: Simple click activation
example.code:
Click me!
I will be activated on click

example.title: Grouping
example.code:
Tab 1 Tab 1 Tab 1
Content #1
Content #2
Content #3

example.title: Toggle mode
example.code:
Click me!
I will be toggled on click

href.description: Specify the target element(s) to activate/unactivate

group.description: Specify a group id for your element. This is used for things like tabs, etc...

toggle.description: Specify if you want to be able to click on the same element to activate/unactivate it.

history.description: Specify if you want to store and react to history hash changes

active.description: Specify the initial state of your element

activeClass.description: Specify the class applied on target(s) when active. Default is "active"

activeAttribute.description: Specify the attribute name applied on target(s) when active.

saveState.description: Specify if you want to save state in localStorage to restore it on page reload, etc...

activateTimeout.description: Specify a timeout before actiavting the target(s)

unactivateTimeout.description: Specify a timeout before unactivate the target(s)

triggerer.description: Specify an element selector that will be used as the triggerer instead of this current element

trigger.description: Specify what trigger an activate/unactivate action. Can be "click", "mouseover", "mouseout" and/or "anchor"

unactivateOn.description: Specify some event(s) catched on the body tag that will unactivate the target(s)

isactive.name: isActive
isactive.description: This method allows you to know if this particular s-activate node is active or not

activate.name: activate
activate.description: This async method allows you to activate this particular s-activate node

unactivate.name: unactivate
unactivate.description: This async method allows you to unactivate this particular s-activate node

@example.01-basic.sugar.style.ui.Toggles.name: Toggles
@example.01-basic.sugar.style.ui.Toggles.description:
These classes allows you to display any HTMLElement as a toggle.
Toggles are element that have at least 2 states. Active and unactive.
This active state respect these rules:

- &:active
- &:focus
- &:focus-within
- input:checked + &
- input:checked + .s-menu + &
- :active > &
- :focus > &
- :focus-within > &
- &:has(input:checked)
- input:checked +
> &
- input:checked + .s-menu +
> &

example.title: Toggles
example.code: burger

These classes allows you to apply an offsize to any HTMLElement.
An offsize is a "space" that you want to ADD to the width/height of an element.
You can specify where you want to add this offsize like for margin and padding by using the "inline" and "block" notation.

@example.01-basic.sugar.style.tools.Scal.name: Scale
@example.01-basic.sugar.style.tools.Scal.description:
These classes allows to apply a scale to any supported UI elements.
This scale does not use the transform property but increase actual values like `padding`,
`margin`, etc... In fact, all the properties setted with the `sugar.scallable` function.
It's usually a good practice to set the `font-size` of your UI element to `sugar.scalable(1rem)`
and then to set inner values using `em` unit.

@example.01-basic.sugar.style.ui.Icons.name: Icons
@example.01-basic.sugar.style.ui.Icons.description:
These classes represent all the icons that you have listed in your project using the @sugar.icon.classes mixin.
By using this mixin, your icons will be accessible using the same s-icon:{name} classes
independently of the icon source that can be *Fontawesome** or your **Filesystem**.
These providers are the one that we support for now but others can be added if needed.

global reset.name: Global reset
global reset.description:
These mixins allows you to apply some resets like `destyle` and/or the `sugar` one.
The `destyle` one is well known and you can find the documentation on their website.
The `sugar` one is our own that add some resets like setting max-width to 100% for images, and some more. Check our his own documentation page.

destyle reset.name: Destyle reset
destyle reset.description: These mixins allows you to apply the `destyle` reset easily.

sugar reset.name: Sugar reset
sugar reset.description: This mixin allows you to apply the `sugar` reset easily.

package.name: @coffeekraken/cli
package.description: Main Coffeekraken toolchain entry point that expose the sugar CLI and let you release the Kraken!

package.name: @coffeekraken/s-activate-feature
package.description: Simple but powerful feature that let you (un)activate targets on events like "click", "mouseover", "anchor", etc... All of this with controls like grouping to create tabs, handle history or event save state.

docmap.name: SActivateFeature
docmap.description:
This feature allows you to activate some elements depending on triggers like `click`, `mouseover`, `mouseout`, `anchor`, etc...
To be explicit, you can apply this feature on a link tag with the href attribute `#something`, and on click,
the DOM element that has the id "something" will get the "active" class applied.

example.title: Simple click activation
example.code:
Click me!
I will be activated on click

example.title: Grouping
example.code:
Tab 1 Tab 1 Tab 1
Content #1
Content #2
Content #3

example.title: Toggle mode
example.code:
Click me!
I will be toggled on click

href.description: Specify the target element(s) to activate/unactivate

group.description: Specify a group id for your element. This is used for things like tabs, etc...

toggle.description: Specify if you want to be able to click on the same element to activate/unactivate it.

history.description: Specify if you want to store and react to history hash changes

active.description: Specify the initial state of your element

activeClass.description: Specify the class applied on target(s) when active. Default is "active"

activeAttribute.description: Specify the attribute name applied on target(s) when active.

saveState.description: Specify if you want to save state in localStorage to restore it on page reload, etc...

activateTimeout.description: Specify a timeout before actiavting the target(s)

unactivateTimeout.description: Specify a timeout before unactivate the target(s)

triggerer.description: Specify an element selector that will be used as the triggerer instead of this current element

trigger.description: Specify what trigger an activate/unactivate action. Can be "click", "mouseover", "mouseout" and/or "anchor"

unactivateOn.description: Specify some event(s) catched on the body tag that will unactivate the target(s)

docmap.name: SAppearFeature
docmap.description:
This feature allows you to make some elements appear when it enter the viewport with different
apparition animation as well as custom one depending on your needs.

example.title: Bottom
example.code: I'm the appear element

example.title: Top
example.code: I'm the appear element

example.title: Right
example.code: I'm the appear element

example.title: Left
example.code: I'm the appear element

in.description: Specify the animation you want to use to display your element

out.description: Specify the animation you want to use to hide your item

delay.description: Specify a delay before animation in or out your element. Can be an array of two number that define the min delay and the max delay. The real delay will be random between these two numbers

duration.description: Specify the duration of the animation in ms. Can be an array of two number that define the min delay and the max duration. The real duration will be random between these two numbers

distance.description: Specify the distance that your element will move if you have set an "in" direction. Can be an array of two number that define the min delay and the max distance. The real duration will be random between these two numbers

appear.description: Specify if the element has to appear. This is usually setted automatically when needed

docmap.name: SCodeExampleComponent
docmap.description: This component represent a code example that make sure your passed code(s) is displayed well using under the hood the AMAZING [highlightjs](https://highlightjs.org/) library.

example.code:
<s-code-example>
     <template lang="js">
function $initHighlight(block, cls) {
try {
  if (cls.search(/\bno\-highlight\b/) != -1)
    return process(block, true, 0x0F) +
           ` class="${cls}"`;
} catch (e) {
}
for (var i = 0 / 2; i < classes.length; i++) {
  if (checkCondition(classes[i]) === undefined)
    console.log('undefined');
}
     </template>
</s-code-example>

import { define } from '@coffeekraken/s-code-example-component';
define();

active.description: Specify which "tab" is active in case of multiple languages examples

toolbar.description: Specify what you want in the toolbar. Currently available item is "copy"

toolbarPosition.description: Specify the toolbar position. Can be "content" or "nav"

languages.description: Specify some languages that you want to support. Must be "[key]: language" object syntax. See [highlight.js doc](https://github.com/highlightjs/highlight.js/blob/main/SUPPORTED_LANGUAGES.md) for supported languages

items.description: Specify the items to put in your code example

lines.description: Specify how many lines to display at max

moreAction.description: Specify the action to execute when click on the "more" button. Currently available action is "toggle"

more.description: Specify if you want to expand the more feature at start or not

scrollOnMore.description: Specify if you want to scroll to the code when clicking on the "show more/less" button

docmap.name: SColorPickerComponent
docmap.description:
This component specify a color picker. It uses under the hood the **AMAZING Pickr library** with some additional features like
sugar theming support as well as some events and more.
Almost all the Pickr options are available through properties. Check out the api documentation for more details...

example.title: With a different format (hsla)
Just a button
Disabled
RTL Support

name.description: Specify the name that will be assigned to the injected input if you don't provide one yourself

value.description: Specify the initial value for your picker

updateInput.description: Specify when you want to updat the attached input. Can be "pointermove", "pointerup", "pointerdown", "input", "validate", "close"

format.description: Specify the format of the color you want as end in the input value. Can be "hex", "hexa", "rgb", "rgba", "hsl" or "hsla"

inline.description: Specify if you want to initalize the color picker inline or if you want it to be displayed only when the focus is in the input

i18n.description: Specify some translations for the color picker. You can translate the "reset", "clear" and "validate" buttons

placeholder.description: Specify the placeholder that will be assigned to the injected input if you don't provide one yourself

backdrop.description: Specify if you want the ".s-backdrop" element or not

eyeDropper.description: Specify if you want the eye dropper capability to pick a color anywhere on the screen or not

actions.description: Specify the actions buttons you want to display. Can be "clear", "reset" and "validate". If false, hide all button

floatSettings.description: Specify some float settings to pass to the "makeFloat" function of the sugar toolkit

eyeDropperIconClass.description: Specify the class you want to apply on the "i" that display the "eyeDropper" icon

copyIconClass.description: Specify the class you want to apply on the "i" that display the "copy" icon

copiedIconClass.description: Specify the class you want to apply on the "i" that display the "copy" icon when the color has been copied

buttonIconClass.description: Specify the class you want to apply on the injected button icon

backdropClass.description: Specify the class to apply on the backdrop when the "backdrop" prop is true

disabled.description: Specify if the color picker is disabled

package.description: Powerful web component that let you create simple and complexe filtrable input like search completion, etc...

docmap.name: SFiltrableInputComponent
docmap.description: This component represent a filtrable input to display and filter a list of items easily.

example.title: Simple example
example.code:
<template id="items">
  [{"title":"Hello","value":"hello"},{"title":"world","value":"world"}]
</template>
<s-filtrable-input items="#items" label="title" filtrable="title">
  <input type="text" class="s-input" placeholder="Type something..." />
</s-filtrable-input>

import { define } from '@coffeekraken/s-filtrable-input-component';
define();

example.title: Custom templates and items
example.code:
<my-cool-filtrable-input>
   <input type="text" class="s-input" placeholder="Type something..." />
</my-cool-filtrable-input>

items.description: Specify an array of items to use in your filtrable list. Can be a JSON string, a function that take an object with the "value" property and must return an array of items to use

value.description: Specify the attribute in your items to use as a value. Can be also a function that will be called with an object containing the selected item and must return the string you want to use as value

label.description: Specify the attribute in your items to use as a label. Can be also a function that will be called with an object containing the selected item and must return the string you want to use as label

emptyText.description: Specify the text to use for the default "empty" (no result) state

searchValuePreprocess.description: Specify a function used to preprocess the value just before actually searching through the items

loadingText.description: Specify the text to use for the default "loading" state

filter.description: Specify a function to use to filter the items. Must return the filtered list of items

filtrable.description: Specify all the properties of your "item" to use as source for the filtrable process

showKeywords.description: Specify if you want to display the "keywords" section on top of the list results

templates.description: Specify either an object with properties like "item", "empty" and "loading", or a function returning the good template depending on tne "type" argument property

closeTimeout.description: Specify the duration before closing the list when having selected an item

interactive.description: Specify if your items in the list are interactive or not to let the user click and interact with them

closeOnSelect.description: Specify if you wantr to close the list when selecting an item

resetOnSelect.description: Specify if you want your filtrable input to be reseted on select

notSelectable.description: Specify if you want the items to be not selectable

maxItems.description: Specify the maximum number of items to display at first in the list

classes.description: Specify some additional classes to add to the component elements

inline.description: Specify if you want the filterable input list to be always displayed and inline in the html

define.name: define
define.description:
This function allows you to define (register) your custom element with some default
props if needed.

max.description: Validate string, array, object and number using the "max" rule

required.description: Make sure a value has been provided

pattern.description: Validate a string using a regex pattern

minMessage.description: The message to display when the validator "min" fails

maxMessage.description: The message to display when the validator "max" fails

emailMessage.description: The message to display when the validator "email" fails

requiredMessage.description: The message to display when the validator "required" fails

isoDateMessage.description: The message to display when the validator "isoDate" fails

isoTimeMessage.description: The message to display when the validator "isoTime" fails

isoDateTimeMessage.description: The message to display when the validator "isoDateTime" fails

integerMessage.description: The message to display when the validator "integer" fails

numberMessage.description: The message to display when the validator "number" fails

negativeMessage.description: The message to display when the validator "negative" fails

positiveMessage.description: The message to display when the validator "positive" fails

patternMessage.description: The message to display when the validator "pattern" fails

alphanumMessage.description: The message to display when the validator "alphanum" fails

creditCardMessage.description: The message to display when the validator "creditCard" fails

colorMessage.description: The message to display when the validator "color" fails

hexMessage.description: The message to display when the validator "hex" fails

passwordMessage.description: The message to display when the validator "password" fails

type.description: Specify the validation type. Usually automatically detected depending on the field type

on.description: Specify when to trigger a validation. Can be "change","submit","enter" and/or "reset"

format.description: Specify if you want your value to be formatted a certain way. You can specify every "import { __format } from `@coffeekraken/sugar/string`" supported formats

errorClass.description: Specify the class to apply when theres an error

validClass.description: Specify the class to apply on your s-form-validate element when validation is passed successfully

handlers.description: Specify some custom handlers by validator that will be executed in addition to the default validate behavior. The handler will take as argument an object containing the "result" SValidator result, the "$feature" that represent the s-validate node, the "$form" node if exists, the "$node" attached node if using the "nodes" property, the "$field" that represent the input field handled and the "props" that represent the feature properties

nodes.description: Specify a css selector that target some HTMLElements used for the validation. Every HTMLElement has to specify 1 validator by using element attributes (same as on the feature itself). Classes are applied on each "node" to specify if the validator is valid or not

language.description: Specify the language you want to use for messages

displayError.description: Specify if you want to display the error messages or not

errorContainerAttr.description: Specify the attribute to search for the error container. If not found, a default container will be created and inserted after your s-form-validate element

package.name: @coffeekraken/s-form-validate-feature
package.description: Powerful feature that you can use to validate your form inputs using rules like "password", "min", "email", and a lot more...

docmap.name: SPageTransitionFeature
docmap.description:
This feature allows you to add page transition to your size by using ajax requests and configurable
transition effects.

example.title: Simple example
example.code:
On your body tag, put the s-page-transition attribute

This website is a perfect example of this feature behavior...

This link will reload this same page using a page transition...

example.title: Update only a part of the page
example.code:
To update only a part of the UI, simply add the s-page-transition-container="something" on the part you want to be updated

If this same container exists in the loaded page, only this part will be updated.

This website is a perfect example of this feature behavior...

This link will reload this same page using a page transition...

patchBody.description: Specify if you want to patch the body tag with the new page body tag

scrollTop.description: Specify if you want to scroll to the top of the updated element after a transition

before.description: Specify a function to run before the transition

after.description: Specify a function to run after the transition

autoStyle.description: Specify if you want to automatically add classes like "s-tc:error" on the broken links (only the "a" tags)

injectBrokenLinkIcon.description: Specify if you want to inject the "error" icon on the broken links

brokenLinkIcon.description: Specify the icon you want to inject on the broken links

ga.description: Specify if you want to track pages change using google analytics of not. If true, will use the config.google.ga configuration as target, otherwise you can specify the gtag universal id here...

package.name: @coffeekraken/s-page-transition-feature
package.description: Handle your pages transition easily with automatically applying ajax requests on your links, as well as refreshing only the page section needed.

package.name: @coffeekraken/s-process

package.name: @coffeekraken/s-range-component
package.description: Create nice and clean ranges using this web component. Support tooltip, target to display value, and more...

docmap.name: SRangeComponent
docmap.description:
This component specify a range with some additional features than the native one like
displaying the value automatically in tooltip or inline.

example.title: Simple range
example.code: <s-range name="myCoolRange" value="90" class="s-color:accent s-mbe:30"></s-range>

example.title: With tooltip
example.code: <s-range name="myOtherRanfe" class="s-mbe:30" tooltip></s-range>

example.title: With tooltip and colored
example.code: <s-range name="myOtherRanfe" class="s-mbe:30 s-color:accent" tooltip></s-range>

example.title: With steps
example.code: <s-range name="myRangeWithSteps" value="70" class="s-color:complementary s-mbe:30" step="5"></s-range>

example.title: Disabled
example.code: <s-range name="myRangeWithSteps" disabled value="70" class="s-color:complementary s-mbe:30" step="5"></s-range>

example.title: External target input
Some colors
example.code:
<s-range name="myRangeColoredSuccess" value="30" class="s-color:success s-mbe:30"></s-range>
<s-range name="myRangeColoredWarning" value="0" class="s-color:warning s-mbe:30"></s-range>
<s-range name="myRangeColoredError" value="1" min="0" max="10" class="s-color:error s-mbe:30"></s-range>

name.description: Specify the name to assign to the internal input[type="range"]

value.description: Specify the initial range value

min.description: Specify the minimal value or the range

max.description: Specify the maximal value of the range

step.description: Specify the steps between each values

target.description: Specify a css selector of any HTMLElement or HTMLInputElement in which to inject the value when the range is updated

tooltip.description: Specify if you want to display the value inside a tooltip on top of the thumb

disabled.description: Specify if this range is disabled

webcomponent.name: webcomponent
webcomponent.description:
This function allows you to define (register) your webcomponent with some default
props if needed.

package.name: @coffeekraken/s-range-component
package.description: Create nice and clean ranges using this web component. Support tooltip, target to display value, and more...

package.name: @coffeekraken/s-rating-component
package.description: Clean, fully customizable and easy to use (stars) rating web component.

docmap.name: SRatingComponent
docmap.description: This component represent a simple rating "stars" based component. You can as well choose the icon you want to use, the number of them, etc...

example.title: Simple rating
example.code: <s-rating name="my-rating" class="s-color:accent"></s-rating>

example.title: More stars
example.code: <s-rating name="my-rating" class="s-color:accent" min="1" max="10"></s-rating>

example.title: Different icon and color
example.code: <s-rating name="my-rating" class="s-color:error" icon="heart"></s-rating>

example.title: Changing size
example.code: <s-rating name="my-rating" class="s-color:accent s-font:80"></s-rating>

name.description: Specify a name that will be attributed to the hidden input created automatically

value.description: Specify a base value for the rating

min.description: Specify the minimum rate you accept

max.description: Specify the maximum rate you accept

icon.description: This works only if you use the "s-icon:..." class notation. Define the icon you want to use

iconClass.description: Specify a custom icon class you want to use. If this is set, override the "icon" parameter

readonly.description: Specify if you want your rating component to just display the value and that the user cannot interact with it or not

package.name: @coffeekraken/s-rating-component

nextIconClass.description: Specify the class of the next icon

previousIconClass.description: Specify the class of the previous icon

uiContainer.description: Specify if you want an "s-container:..." class applied on the .s-slider__ui element

controls.description: Specify if you want to display the controls or not. Controls are the previous and next icons

nav.description: Specify if you want to display the nav or not. Nav are the dots

swipe.description: Specify if you want your slider to support swipe navigation or not

mousewheel.description: Specify if you want to enable the mousewheel event on the slider or not

clickOnSlide.description: Specify if you want to enable the click on the slides to navigate or not

loop.description: Specify if you want to enable the loop behavior or not

progress.description: Specify if you want to display the progress bar or not

timer.description: Specify a timer that will be applied on each slides and go to the next one after the timer is over. For custom timer by slide, specify the `timer="1200"` attribute on the slides you want

autoplay.description: Specify if you want the slider to auto play itself when some timer(s) has been set

intersectionClasses.description: Specify if you want the classes that describe each slide intersection classes like "in-10", "in-20", etc...

transitionDuration.description: Specify the transition duration of the slider in ms

transitionEasing.description: Specify the transition easing of the slider

transitionHandler.description: Specify a function that will take care of transitioning the slider from the current item to the next/previous

applypad.name: applyPad
applypad.description: This method apply the "pad" start and end on the slides wrapper

islast.name: isLast
islast.description: This method allows you to check if the actual slide is the last one

isfirst.name: isFirst
isfirst.description: This method allows you to check if the actual slide is the first one

getcurrentslideidx.name: getCurrentSlideIdx
getcurrentslideidx.description: Access the current slide idx. Begin from 0...

setcurrentslide.name: setCurrentSlide
setcurrentslide.description: This method allows you to get the current clide using an id or an idx.

currentslideidx.name: currentSlideIdx
currentslideidx.description: Access the current slide idx. Begin from 0...

getslideidxbyid.name: getSlideIdxById
getslideidxbyid.description: This method allows you to get back the slide idx by its id.

getslideelementbyidx.name: getSlideElementByIdx
getslideelementbyidx.description: This method allows you to get back a slide HTMLElement by its index.

getcurrentslide.name: getCurrentSlide
getcurrentslide.description: This method allows you to get back the current slide object <ISSliderComponentSlide> either by it's id, or by it's idx.

getslide.name: getSlide
getslide.description: This method allows you to get back a slide object <ISSliderComponentSlide> either by it's id, or by it's idx.

getfirstslide.name: getFirstSlide
getfirstslide.description: This method allows you to get the first slide of the slider

getlastslide.name: getLastSlide
getlastslide.description: This method allows you to get the last slide of the slider

getbehavior.name: getBehavior
getbehavior.description:
This method allows you to get the behavior object with all his functions binded
to this current slider instance

updateslidesclasses.name: updateSlidesClasses
updateslidesclasses.description:
This method allows you to update the slides "active" class accordingly to the
slider state. This can be used inside of a custom behavior for example.

gettimer.name: getTimer
gettimer.description: This method allows you to get back the timer object

isplaying.name: isPlaying
isplaying.description: This method allows you to know if the slider is currently playing or not

play.name: play
play.description: This method allows you to play the slider when a `timer` has been defined

stop.name: stop
stop.description: This method allows you to stop the slider

webcomponent.name: webcomponent
webcomponent.description:
This function allows you to define (register) your webcomponent with some default
props if needed.

package.name: @coffeekraken/s-slider-component
package.description: Powerful web component to create nice and fully customizable sliders. Support behaviors like slideable, horizontal|vertical, and more...

package.name: @coffeekraken/s-static-builder
package.description: Simple builder that let you specify a sitemap.xml file as source, and generate a static version of the website by scraping each urls.

package.name: @coffeekraken/s-stdio
package.description: Clean and extensible Stdio system that make use of the @coffeekraken/s-event-emitter event system to listen to "log" or "ask" events and display them nicely with our built-in terminal implementation or anywhere else if you extends it.

package.name: @coffeekraken/s-sugar-config
package.description: Powerful config management class that let you access the .config.(j|t)s files stored either at (mono)repo, package (.sugar/*) or user (.local/.sugar/*) level.

docmap.name: SSugarFeature
docmap.description:
This feature allows you to apply some "nice to have" features like having a "scrolled" class applied on the body
when the user has scroll in the page or having access to a `--vh` css variable that represent the exact
viewport innerHeight and avoid having issues with mobile different viewport height values. Note that if you use
the `sPostcssSugarPlugin` postcss plugin, you can use the `vh` unit as normal and if will automatically take the
value of the `--vh` variable if it exists.
More feature can be added in the future depending on the needs.

example.title: Simple usage
example.description: Simply add the `s-sugar` property on your body tag
example.code:
<bodyTag s-sugar>

</bodyTag>

pleasantCss.description: Specify if you want the "pleasant css" syntax in your pages

containerQuery.description: Specify if you want support for container queries in your css or not

scrolled.description: Specify if you want the `scrolled` class to be applied on the `body` element when the page has been scrolled

scrolledDelta.description: Specify after how many scroll the scrolled class will be applied

vhvar.description: Specify if you want the `--vh` css variable to be computed and available

inputAdditionalAttributes.description: Specify if you want to have the additional attributes on inputs like "has-value", "empty" and "dirty" or not

resizeTransmations.description: Specify if you want all the transitions and animations cleared during window resize

linksStateAttributes.description: Specify if you want to have the state attributes on links like "actual" and "actual-child" or not

preventScrollRestoration.description: Specify if you want to prevent the scroll restoration behavior on chrome that can usually be anoying

env.description: Specify if you want to display the current environment at start

package.name: @coffeekraken/s-sugar-feature
package.description: Global feature that you can apply on your body and that will handle convinient things like automatically expand your "pleasant css" classes, add/remove a "scrolled" class on the body, remove animations when user resize the page, and more...

package.name: @coffeekraken/s-sugar-json
package.description: Simple class that let you list and read sugar.json files. A sugar.json file is more or less the configuration you want to apply in your project regarding the Coffeekraken toolchain...

package.name: @coffeekraken/s-theme

package.name: @coffeekraken/s-theme-switcher-component

docmap.name: Toggles
docmap.description:
These classes allows you to display any HTMLElement as a toggle.
Toggles are element that have at least 2 states. Active and unactive.
This active state respect these rules:

- &:active
- &:focus
- &:focus-within
- input:checked + &
- input:checked + .s-menu + &
- :active > &
- :focus > &
- :focus-within > &
- &:has(input:checked)
- input:checked +
> &
- input:checked + .s-menu +
> &

docmap.name: Offsize
docmap.description:
These classes allows you to apply an offsize to any HTMLElement.
An offsize is a "space" that you want to ADD to the width/height of an element.
You can specify where you want to add this offsize like for margin and padding by using the "inline" and "block" notation.

docmap.name: Scale
docmap.description:
These classes allows to apply a scale to any supported UI elements.
This scale does not use the transform property but increase actual values like `padding`,
`margin`, etc... In fact, all the properties setted with the `sugar.scallable` function.
It's usually a good practice to set the `font-size` of your UI element to `sugar.scalable(1rem)`
and then to set inner values using `em` unit.

global reset.name: Global reset
global reset.description:
These mixins allows you to apply some resets like `destyle` and/or the `sugar` one.
The `destyle` one is well known and you can find the documentation on their website.
The `sugar` one is our own that add some resets like setting max-width to 100% for images, and some more. Check our his own documentation page.

destyle reset.description: These mixins allows you to apply the `destyle` reset easily.

sugar reset.name: Sugar reset
sugar reset.description: This mixin allows you to apply the `sugar` reset easily.

activate.description: This async method allows you to activate this particular s-activate node

unactivate.description: This async method allows you to unactivate this particular s-activate node
