docmap.description:
This feature allows you to activate some elements depending on triggers like `click`, `mouseover`, `mouseout`, `anchor`, etc...
To be explicit, you can apply this feature on a link tag with the href attribute `#something`, and on click,
the DOM element that has the id "something" will get the "active" class applied.

example.title: Simple click activation
example.code:
Click me!
I will be activated on click

example.title: Grouping
example.code:
Tab 1 Tab 1 Tab 1
Content #1
Content #2
Content #3

example.title: Toggle mode
example.code:
Click me!
I will be toggled on click

activateTimeout.description: Specify a timeout before actiavting the target(s)

active.description: Specify the initial state of your element

activeAttribute.description: Specify the attribute name applied on target(s) when active.

activeClass.description: Specify the class applied on target(s) when active. Default is "active"

group.description: Specify a group id for your element. This is used for things like tabs, etc...

history.description: Specify if you want to store and react to history hash changes

href.description: Specify the target element(s) to activate/unactivate

saveState.description: Specify if you want to save state in localStorage to restore it on page reload, etc...

toggle.description: Specify if you want to be able to click on the same element to activate/unactivate it.

trigger.description: Specify what trigger an activate/unactivate action. Can be "click", "mouseover", "mouseout" and/or "anchor"

triggerer.description: Specify an element selector that will be used as the triggerer instead of this current element

unactivateOn.description: Specify some event(s) catched on the body tag that will unactivate the target(s)

unactivateTimeout.description: Specify a timeout before unactivate the target(s)

docmap.name: SActivateFeature

package.description: Simple but powerful feature that let you (un)activate targets on events like "click", "mouseover", "anchor", etc... All of this with controls like grouping to create tabs, handle history or event save state.
package.name: @coffeekraken/s-activate-feature

docmap.description:
This feature allows you to make some elements appear when it enter the viewport with different
apparition animation as well as custom one depending on your needs.

example.title: Bottom
example.code: I'm the appear element

example.title: Top
example.code: I'm the appear element

example.title: Right
example.code: I'm the appear element

example.title: Left
example.code: I'm the appear element

appear.description: Specify if the element has to appear. This is usually setted automatically when needed

delay.description: Specify a delay before animation in or out your element. Can be an array of two number that define the min delay and the max delay. The real delay will be random between these two numbers

distance.description: Specify the distance that your element will move if you have set an "in" direction. Can be an array of two number that define the min delay and the max distance. The real duration will be random between these two numbers

duration.description: Specify the duration of the animation in ms. Can be an array of two number that define the min delay and the max duration. The real duration will be random between these two numbers

in.description: Specify the animation you want to use to display your element

out.description: Specify the animation you want to use to hide your item

docmap.description: This component represent a code example that make sure your passed code(s) is displayed well using under the hood the AMAZING [highlightjs](https://highlightjs.org/) library.

example.code:
<s-code-example>
     <template lang="js">
function $initHighlight(block, cls) {
try {
  if (cls.search(/\bno\-highlight\b/) != -1)
    return process(block, true, 0x0F) +
           ` class="${cls}"`;
} catch (e) {
}
for (var i = 0 / 2; i < classes.length; i++) {
  if (checkCondition(classes[i]) === undefined)
    console.log('undefined');
}
     </template>
</s-code-example>

import { define } from '@coffeekraken/s-code-example-component';
define();

active.description: Specify which "tab" is active in case of multiple languages examples

items.description: Specify the items to put in your code example

languages.description: Specify some languages that you want to support. Must be "[key]: language" object syntax. See [highlight.js doc](https://github.com/highlightjs/highlight.js/blob/main/SUPPORTED_LANGUAGES.md) for supported languages

lines.description: Specify how many lines to display at max

more.description: Specify if you want to expand the more feature at start or not

moreAction.description: Specify the action to execute when click on the "more" button. Currently available action is "toggle"

scrollOnMore.description: Specify if you want to scroll to the code when clicking on the "show more/less" button

toolbar.description: Specify what you want in the toolbar. Currently available item is "copy"

toolbarPosition.description: Specify the toolbar position. Can be "content" or "nav"

docmap.description:
This component specify a color picker. It uses under the hood the **AMAZING Pickr library** with some additional features like
sugar theming support as well as some events and more.
Almost all the Pickr options are available through properties. Check out the api documentation for more details...

example.title: With a different format (hsla)
Just a button
Disabled
RTL Support

actions.description: Specify the actions buttons you want to display. Can be "clear", "reset" and "validate". If false, hide all button

backdrop.description: Specify if you want the ".s-backdrop" element or not

backdropClass.description: Specify the class to apply on the backdrop when the "backdrop" prop is true

buttonIconClass.description: Specify the class you want to apply on the injected button icon

copiedIconClass.description: Specify the class you want to apply on the "i" that display the "copy" icon when the color has been copied

copyIconClass.description: Specify the class you want to apply on the "i" that display the "copy" icon

disabled.description: Specify if the color picker is disabled

eyeDropper.description: Specify if you want the eye dropper capability to pick a color anywhere on the screen or not

eyeDropperIconClass.description: Specify the class you want to apply on the "i" that display the "eyeDropper" icon

floatSettings.description: Specify some float settings to pass to the "makeFloat" function of the sugar toolkit

format.description: Specify the format of the color you want as end in the input value. Can be "hex", "hexa", "rgb", "rgba", "hsl" or "hsla"

i18n.description: Specify some translations for the color picker. You can translate the "reset", "clear" and "validate" buttons

inline.description: Specify if you want to initalize the color picker inline or if you want it to be displayed only when the focus is in the input

name.description: Specify the name that will be assigned to the injected input if you don't provide one yourself

placeholder.description: Specify the placeholder that will be assigned to the injected input if you don't provide one yourself

updateInput.description: Specify when you want to updat the attached input. Can be "pointermove", "pointerup", "pointerdown", "input", "validate", "close"

value.description: Specify the initial value for your picker

docmap.description: This component allows you to drop files on it and handle upload for you easily.

example.title: Copy from an input
example.code: <s-dropzone action="/upload"></s-dropzone>

accept.description: Specify which file types are accepted. Exactly the same as the "accept" attribute of the input[type="file"]

dropFileIcon.description: Specify the html to be used for the "drop" icon when no file have been droped

errorTimeout.description: Specify how many ms the error class is applied on the dropzone when something goes wrong

files.description: Specify some initial file(s) to be used and displayed in the UI. MUST contain at least a "src" attribute by file passed

helpIcon.description: Specify the html to be used for the "help" icon

i18n.description: Specify some words/sentences to be translated

input.description: Specify if you want an input[type="file"] or not

maxFiles.description: Specify the maximum files that can be droped on the dropzone at once

maxSize.description: Specify the maximum file size accepted by the dropzone

name.description: Specify a name for the input[type="file"] input that will be created if you set the "input" property to true

upload.description: Specify if you want the droped file(s) to be uploaded or not

uploadUrl.description: Specify the url where to upload the file(s)

docmap.name: SDropzoneComponent

package.description: Simple to use asset selector that allows you to choose for images, video or other files

define.description:
This function allows you to define (register) your custom element with some default
props if needed.
define.name: define

docmap.description: This component represent a filtrable input to display and filter a list of items easily.

example.title: Simple example
example.code:
<template id="items">
  [{"title":"Hello","value":"hello"},{"title":"world","value":"world"}]
</template>
<s-filtrable-input items="#items" label="title" filtrable="title">
  <input type="text" class="s-input" placeholder="Type something..." />
</s-filtrable-input>

import { define } from '@coffeekraken/s-filtrable-input-component';
define();

example.title: Custom templates and items
example.code:
<my-cool-filtrable-input>
   <input type="text" class="s-input" placeholder="Type something..." />
</my-cool-filtrable-input>

classes.description: Specify some additional classes to add to the component elements

closeOnSelect.description: Specify if you wantr to close the list when selecting an item

closeTimeout.description: Specify the duration before closing the list when having selected an item

emptyText.description: Specify the text to use for the default "empty" (no result) state

filter.description: Specify a function to use to filter the items. Must return the filtered list of items

filtrable.description: Specify all the properties of your "item" to use as source for the filtrable process

inline.description: Specify if you want the filterable input list to be always displayed and inline in the html

interactive.description: Specify if your items in the list are interactive or not to let the user click and interact with them

items.description: Specify an array of items to use in your filtrable list. Can be a JSON string, a function that take an object with the "value" property and must return an array of items to use

label.description: Specify the attribute in your items to use as a label. Can be also a function that will be called with an object containing the selected item and must return the string you want to use as label

loadingText.description: Specify the text to use for the default "loading" state

maxItems.description: Specify the maximum number of items to display at first in the list

notSelectable.description: Specify if you want the items to be not selectable

resetOnSelect.description: Specify if you want your filtrable input to be reseted on select

searchValuePreprocess.description: Specify a function used to preprocess the value just before actually searching through the items

showKeywords.description: Specify if you want to display the "keywords" section on top of the list results

templates.description: Specify either an object with properties like "item", "empty" and "loading", or a function returning the good template depending on tne "type" argument property

value.description: Specify the attribute in your items to use as a value. Can be also a function that will be called with an object containing the selected item and must return the string you want to use as value

docmap.name: SFiltrableInputComponent

package.description: Powerful web component that let you create simple and complexe filtrable input like search completion, etc...
package.name: @coffeekraken/s-filtrable-input-component

example.title: Email field
example.code:
Floating element preview. Try to scroll...
I'm the floating element

arrow.description: Specify if you want an arrow or not

arrowPadding.description: Specify the padding of the arrow in px

arrowSize.description: Specify the size of the arrow in px

offset.description: Specify a space between the floating element and the reference one to respect

position.description: Specify the placement of your floating element. By default it will try to be placed as good as possible.

ref.description: Specify the reference HTMLElement from which to position the floating one. If not specified, will take the previous element in the DOM

shift.description: Specify a space between the floating element and the viewport side to respect

package.description: Simple feature that let you define an HTMLElement as floating element. Make use of the AMAZING floating-ui package under the hood.

docmap.description:
This package expose a simple `SFormValidateFeature` class that allows you to validate
your forms before sending them to your backend.

example.title: Password
Nodes
Email field
Alphanumeric field
Credit card field
Min / Max
Select field
Select min / max
Custom error message
ISO date field
Range min / max
Format
Checkboxes min / max
Submit / Reset

alphanumMessage.description: The message to display when the validator "alphanum" fails

colorMessage.description: The message to display when the validator "color" fails

creditCardMessage.description: The message to display when the validator "creditCard" fails

displayError.description: Specify if you want to display the error messages or not

emailMessage.description: The message to display when the validator "email" fails

errorClass.description: Specify the class to apply when theres an error

errorContainerAttr.description: Specify the attribute to search for the error container. If not found, a default container will be created and inserted after your s-form-validate element

format.description: Specify if you want your value to be formatted a certain way. You can specify every "import { __format } from `@coffeekraken/sugar/string`" supported formats

handlers.description: Specify some custom handlers by validator that will be executed in addition to the default validate behavior. The handler will take as argument an object containing the "result" SValidator result, the "$feature" that represent the s-validate node, the "$form" node if exists, the "$node" attached node if using the "nodes" property, the "$field" that represent the input field handled and the "props" that represent the feature properties

hexMessage.description: The message to display when the validator "hex" fails

integerMessage.description: The message to display when the validator "integer" fails

isoDateMessage.description: The message to display when the validator "isoDate" fails

isoDateTimeMessage.description: The message to display when the validator "isoDateTime" fails

isoTimeMessage.description: The message to display when the validator "isoTime" fails

language.description: Specify the language you want to use for messages

max.description: Validate string, array, object and number using the "max" rule

maxMessage.description: The message to display when the validator "max" fails

min.description: Validate string, array, object and number using the "min" rule

minMessage.description: The message to display when the validator "min" fails

negativeMessage.description: The message to display when the validator "negative" fails

nodes.description: Specify a css selector that target some HTMLElements used for the validation. Every HTMLElement has to specify 1 validator by using element attributes (same as on the feature itself). Classes are applied on each "node" to specify if the validator is valid or not

numberMessage.description: The message to display when the validator "number" fails

on.description: Specify when to trigger a validation. Can be "change","submit","enter" and/or "reset"

passwordMessage.description: The message to display when the validator "password" fails

pattern.description: Validate a string using a regex pattern

patternMessage.description: The message to display when the validator "pattern" fails

positiveMessage.description: The message to display when the validator "positive" fails

required.description: Make sure a value has been provided

requiredMessage.description: The message to display when the validator "required" fails

type.description: Specify the validation type. Usually automatically detected depending on the field type

validClass.description: Specify the class to apply on your s-form-validate element when validation is passed successfully

docmap.name: SFormValidateFeature

package.description: Powerful feature that you can use to validate your form inputs using rules like "password", "min", "email", and a lot more...
package.name: @coffeekraken/s-form-validate-feature

docmap.description:
This feature allows you to add page transition to your size by using ajax requests and configurable
transition effects.

example.title: Simple example
example.code:
On your body tag, put the s-page-transition attribute

This website is a perfect example of this feature behavior...

This link will reload this same page using a page transition...

example.title: Update only a part of the page
example.code:
To update only a part of the UI, simply add the s-page-transition-container="something" on the part you want to be updated

If this same container exists in the loaded page, only this part will be updated.

This website is a perfect example of this feature behavior...

This link will reload this same page using a page transition...

after.description: Specify a function to run after the transition

autoStyle.description: Specify if you want to automatically add classes like "s-tc:error" on the broken links (only the "a" tags)

before.description: Specify a function to run before the transition

brokenLinkIcon.description: Specify the icon you want to inject on the broken links

ga.description: Specify if you want to track pages change using google analytics of not. If true, will use the config.google.ga configuration as target, otherwise you can specify the gtag universal id here...

injectBrokenLinkIcon.description: Specify if you want to inject the "error" icon on the broken links

patchBody.description: Specify if you want to patch the body tag with the new page body tag

scrollTop.description: Specify if you want to scroll to the top of the updated element after a transition

docmap.name: SPageTransitionFeature

package.description: Handle your pages transition easily with automatically applying ajax requests on your links, as well as refreshing only the page section needed.
package.name: @coffeekraken/s-page-transition-feature

docmap.description:
This component specify a range with some additional features than the native one like
displaying the value automatically in tooltip or inline.

example.title: Simple range
example.code: <s-range name="myCoolRange" value="90" class="s-color:accent s-mbe:30"></s-range>

example.title: With tooltip
example.code: <s-range name="myOtherRanfe" class="s-mbe:30" tooltip></s-range>

example.title: With tooltip and colored
example.code: <s-range name="myOtherRanfe" class="s-mbe:30 s-color:accent" tooltip></s-range>

example.title: With steps
example.code: <s-range name="myRangeWithSteps" value="70" class="s-color:complementary s-mbe:30" step="5"></s-range>

example.title: Disabled
example.code: <s-range name="myRangeWithSteps" disabled value="70" class="s-color:complementary s-mbe:30" step="5"></s-range>

example.title: External target input
Some colors
example.code:
<s-range name="myRangeColoredSuccess" value="30" class="s-color:success s-mbe:30"></s-range>
<s-range name="myRangeColoredWarning" value="0" class="s-color:warning s-mbe:30"></s-range>
<s-range name="myRangeColoredError" value="1" min="0" max="10" class="s-color:error s-mbe:30"></s-range>

disabled.description: Specify if this range is disabled

max.description: Specify the maximal value of the range

min.description: Specify the minimal value or the range

name.description: Specify the name to assign to the internal input[type="range"]

step.description: Specify the steps between each values

target.description: Specify a css selector of any HTMLElement or HTMLInputElement in which to inject the value when the range is updated

tooltip.description: Specify if you want to display the value inside a tooltip on top of the thumb

value.description: Specify the initial range value

docmap.name: SRangeComponent

package.description: Create nice and clean ranges using this web component. Support tooltip, target to display value, and more...
package.name: @coffeekraken/s-range-component

docmap.description: This component represent a simple rating "stars" based component. You can as well choose the icon you want to use, the number of them, etc...

example.title: Simple rating
example.code: <s-rating name="my-rating" class="s-color:accent"></s-rating>

example.title: More stars
example.code: <s-rating name="my-rating" class="s-color:accent" min="1" max="10"></s-rating>

example.title: Different icon and color
example.code: <s-rating name="my-rating" class="s-color:error" icon="heart"></s-rating>

example.title: Changing size
example.code: <s-rating name="my-rating" class="s-color:accent s-font:80"></s-rating>

icon.description: This works only if you use the "s-icon:..." class notation. Define the icon you want to use

iconClass.description: Specify a custom icon class you want to use. If this is set, override the "icon" parameter

max.description: Specify the maximum rate you accept

min.description: Specify the minimum rate you accept

name.description: Specify a name that will be attributed to the hidden input created automatically

readonly.description: Specify if you want your rating component to just display the value and that the user cannot interact with it or not

value.description: Specify a base value for the rating

package.description: Clean, fully customizable and easy to use (stars) rating web component.
package.name: @coffeekraken/s-rating-component

autoplay.description: Specify if you want the slider to auto play itself when some timer(s) has been set

behavior.description: Specify which behavior your want to use for your slider. Behavior are like "presets" with different animations, etc...

behaviors.description: Specify the available behaviors for the slider

clickOnSlide.description: Specify if you want to enable the click on the slides to navigate or not

controls.description: Specify if you want to display the controls or not. Controls are the previous and next icons

direction.description: Specify the slider direction. Can be `horizontal` or `vertical`

intersectionClasses.description: Specify if you want the classes that describe each slide intersection classes like "in-10", "in-20", etc...

loop.description: Specify if you want to enable the loop behavior or not

mousewheel.description: Specify if you want to enable the mousewheel event on the slider or not

nav.description: Specify if you want to display the nav or not. Nav are the dots

nextIconClass.description: Specify the class of the next icon

pad.description: Specify if you want to pad the slides if for example the first slide does not take the while width of the slider, a padding-(block|inline)-start will be applied to center this first slide. Same for the last one

previousIconClass.description: Specify the class of the previous icon

progress.description: Specify if you want to display the progress bar or not

swipe.description: Specify if you want your slider to support swipe navigation or not

timer.description: Specify a timer that will be applied on each slides and go to the next one after the timer is over. For custom timer by slide, specify the `timer="1200"` attribute on the slides you want

transitionDuration.description: Specify the transition duration of the slider in ms

transitionEasing.description: Specify the transition easing of the slider

transitionHandler.description: Specify a function that will take care of transitioning the slider from the current item to the next/previous

uiContainer.description: Specify if you want an "s-container:..." class applied on the .s-slider__ui element

docmap.name: SSliderComponent

package.description: Powerful web component to create nice and fully customizable sliders. Support behaviors like slideable, horizontal|vertical, and more...
package.name: @coffeekraken/s-slider-component

docmap.description:
This feature allows you to apply some "nice to have" features like having a "scrolled" class applied on the body
when the user has scroll in the page or having access to a `--vh` css variable that represent the exact
viewport innerHeight and avoid having issues with mobile different viewport height values. Note that if you use
the `sPostcssSugarPlugin` postcss plugin, you can use the `vh` unit as normal and if will automatically take the
value of the `--vh` variable if it exists.
More feature can be added in the future depending on the needs.

example.title: Simple usage
example.description: Simply add the `s-sugar` property on your body tag
example.code:
<bodyTag s-sugar>

</bodyTag>

containerQuery.description: Specify if you want support for container queries in your css or not

env.description: Specify if you want to display the current environment at start

inputAdditionalAttributes.description: Specify if you want to have the additional attributes on inputs like "has-value", "empty" and "dirty" or not

linksStateAttributes.description: Specify if you want to have the state attributes on links like "actual" and "actual-child" or not

pleasantCss.description: Specify if you want the "pleasant css" syntax in your pages

preventScrollRestoration.description: Specify if you want to prevent the scroll restoration behavior on chrome that can usually be anoying

resizeTransmations.description: Specify if you want all the transitions and animations cleared during window resize

scrolled.description: Specify if you want the `scrolled` class to be applied on the `body` element when the page has been scrolled

scrolledDelta.description: Specify after how many scroll the scrolled class will be applied

vhvar.description: Specify if you want the `--vh` css variable to be computed and available

docmap.name: SSugarFeature

package.description: Global feature that you can apply on your body and that will handle convinient things like automatically expand your "pleasant css" classes, add/remove a "scrolled" class on the body, remove animations when user resize the page, and more...
package.name: @coffeekraken/s-sugar-feature

docmap.description:
These classes allows to apply a scale to any supported UI elements.
This scale does not use the transform property but increase actual values like `padding`,
`margin`, etc... In fact, all the properties setted with the `sugar.scallable` function.
It's usually a good practice to set the `font-size` of your UI element to `sugar.scalable(1rem)`
and then to set inner values using `em` unit.

These classes represent all the icons that you have listed in your project using the @sugar.icon.classes mixin.
By using this mixin, your icons will be accessible using the same s-icon:{name} classes
independently of the icon source that can be *Fontawesome** or your **Filesystem**.
These providers are the one that we support for now but others can be added if needed.

docmap.name: Tabs

docmap.description:
These classes allows you to display any HTMLElement as a toggle.
Toggles are element that have at least 2 states. Active and unactive.
This active state respect these rules:

- &:active
- &:focus
- &:focus-within
- input:checked + &
- input:checked + .s-menu + &
- :active > &
- :focus > &
- :focus-within > &
- &:has(input:checked)
- input:checked +
> &
- input:checked + .s-menu +
> &

example.title: Toggles
example.code: burger
